Reviews.Title: “Bed Linen was like wires!”
Reviews.Author: Cadbo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run down. They advertise Starbucks but they only brew Starbucks house blend.. We couldn't get in touch with the valet to get the car when we was checking out.!! They need to upgrade the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: perthchick20
Reviews.Content: Checked in for 1 night on 4th July, alright stay. From memory I think you had to pay for wireless internet and breakfast. Convenient for me I had to catch a flight from LAX home the next day.

Reviews.Title: “A good night's sleep on a LAX layover”
Reviews.Author: efission
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a quick overnight stay at the Crowne Plaza LAX on a layover. Airport shuttle was easy to access, with convenient times for my flight. Check-in and check-out was uncomplicated, and I had a nice sleep. Wish I could have slept in longer, but such is life.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great value!”
Reviews.Author: Rachelleigh1
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The breakfast buffet is fabulous and I've never been disappointed in a room! The staff is always so nice and accommodating. I will ALWAYS stay here when in the area!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest Crowne Plaza I've seen”
Reviews.Author: evans_jl
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, but not great. Comfortable beds, but hotel itself seems a bit run down. It served its purpose for me though for a quick layover before an early flight the next day. Check in staff were friendly, bar staff were a little indifferent and slow. Don't take your other half here for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 1 star Hotel - shabby front desk treatment + room not cleaned well!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ElGuapo_9
Reviews.Content: I had to fight for a room for four people .... after booking it 3 weeks earlier. Then they lied and said they were full and cannot help us! We were not the only one treated that way. (My wife also heard another ladies complaint: Another lady and her older son were also were given the same run-around and were forced to take a room with one king bed â€¦ WOW. The mother had to sleep with her older son.) After booking it for 4 people, they assign us a room for 2 (one king bed) and said they have no more rooms, they were full. (we booked on Hotwire). After a talk to the manager, we were given a room for 4. (even after they said they had no more rooms for 4). They are liers. Then when we went to the room it was second rate. There was a huge blotch on the carpet, about 3' across. When looking for a sock under the skirting of the bed I found someoneâ€™s candy wrappers, and a large letter from New York. The covers on the bed had a cluster of spots on it, about 1' by 2'. The bathroom Mirror frame was greasy, and dull, I cleaned a patch with water and soap and it sparkled â€¦ it had not been cleaned in several years and perhaps never. They first said that they had no room for 4 people, and that they were booked up, Then they assigned us one after I talked to the manager. Then they said we should have booked the hotel through them direct (not a travel booking company, then things would have been different) yet they had the reservation right there on their screen ...then things would have been different????? I suspect that since we were booked on Hotwire at a reduced rate) they had managed to sell off all of their premium rooms themselves and decided to give us this nasty room to make their point. They gave us an un- renovated (second rate room). What is their game?? They lied to us about not having rooms, they did have our reservation and said that they have the choice of giving us a room with one king bed or a room with two queens. Yet knowing fully that we were 4 people they said the room we get is for 2 people only!. This sort of crape is not necessary. I was in LA with my daughters for a trip to see LA and Disneyland etc. Their hearts were set on a nice hotel for this trip and the hassle and lies I had to deal with were totally unnecessary. We had stayed in several other hotels on this trip, comfort Inn, Hyatt and Red Lion. This was a first, every other Hotel was perfect, leaving the Crown Plaza LAX at the bottom of the list of all Hotels that I have ever stayed in â€¦.Bulgaria, Romania, Turkey included. **I will be calling the hotel to let them know of the shabby treatment. Crown Plaza managers need to know what is happening at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do ask for a room facing off the runway”
Reviews.Author: li_cui2001
Reviews.Content: convenient to catch your flight like mine departing at 7am. remember to ask for a room facing off the runway. my first room given was a one facing toward the runway that was about 500 to 600 feet away, and it was very challenging to sleep thru the night. with switching to a room facing the downtown direction, it was much nicer but still could hear the taking off and touching downs. good part is it was much quieter once it was 12 mid night. Starbucks at first floor. parking is not typically included in your package (~$15/day?). if you do not have previlege status of your hotel membership, or your corporate rate does not include the internet access, you gotta pay for it too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rob F
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here during spring break, it was by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms have been recently renovated and they appear modern and fresh. The atmosphere is very friendly and they have great food. I will definitely stay there again next time I am in Los Angeles. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fine...just don't face the runway”
Reviews.Author: SFWorld
Reviews.Content: To their credit, the owners of the hotel have spent a lot of time and money to update the rooms in the hotel. It looks like the changes were mainly cosmetic (i.e. the bathtub and tile around it looks like it has not been replaced) but it still feels like a new room overall. For airport hotels you do, however, have to keep your expectations low. These hotels serve one purpose- give people arriving or departing a place to stay- it's not an escape or an indulgence to stay at most airport hotels. This one is no different. Everything is now clean and nicer but it's just a solid 3 star hotel. And they have made one bad decision with their new LG tvs- no sleep timer. Not sure why some models have one and others don't - these don't and I love that feature when I travel. Here's the big downside: This is essentially a v-shaped hotel. Everything on the inside of the V looks directly out on a very active LAX runway about 1/2 mile away. That would be fine if the airport operated on a 9-5 scheduled but it is more likely running on a 6AM-11PM schedule. Thought soundproofing is good we are talking about jet planes taking off- you will hear them! If my 5 year-old was here he would love watching the planes take off and land but that is a part of the experience I could do with out. Get a room that does not face the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Jas D
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. There was a Starbucks, Pizzeria and Restaurant in the Lobby along with a Hotel Shop. Was very pleased will stay again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ifly737
Reviews.Content: The Crown has very upscale rooms which are the most functional I have seen for a traveler. Clean, well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Great, with a few flaws...”
Reviews.Author: Swede555
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel was great, offering multiple types of cuisines and an information board with lots of crucial information. This included location of airport shuttle, weather, local restaurants, etc. The airport shuttle was very convenient and quick. We had to wait at the terminal for only about 15 seconds! The bellmen were very helpful, offering to take our bags and one employee was called over to talk Italian to the couple in front of us in the check-in line. the beds were very comfortable, and nicely furnished. However, because the rooms had just been renovated, they smelled industrial... almost like drying paint. Also, the sound proofing of the room wasn't fantastic, as we heard two women arrive around 2:30 in the morning. Overall, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just an overnight stay very close to airport”
Reviews.Author: coopervanning
Reviews.Content: Had an overnight layover at LAX. Quick hotel transfer and we were in our room in no time. Restaurant in hotel was passable.Morning breakdfast was very good selection. Hotel had a good fitness room and pool. Airport noise is there but we slept like babies.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Hotel LAX”
Reviews.Author: naukilo
Reviews.Content: Great service at this hotel. Checked in from a twice delayed flight from Honolulu and was whisked to my room in no time. Comfortable beds and great people working the front desk. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: robert c
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four or five times when coming to Los Angeles. It is quite convenient to LAX (which frankly is the only reason I come to this town ... simply meaning I am always in transit when I come here) so is a good choice for me. The pros are as follows: 1) Check-in has always gone smoothly and the person behind the desk friendly and helpful. 2) The rooms have been renovated. 3) A sushi bar downstairs with a pizza place and starbucks place across the way. 4) Good breakfast (as long as you don't have to take an early morning flight. Cons: 1) The food in the lounge is okay. Nothing to write home about. 2) When getting out of th car you do not have the choice of using a luggage cart to take your own luggage to your room. The carts are all locked and only the valets have use of them. Still, as I said this is where I stay. Will I continue to? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 74inspector
Reviews.Content: The check in was very easy and quick. The rooms are very big and clean. Over all a nice stay. The hotel has a good resturant and a Starbucks if you are in need of coffee. If you don't need to get up early be aware the corridor is loud, everybody getting up early and slamming doors.It was rough to get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, next time in LA hope I stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Multani1141
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Friday-Sunday. The room was very nice, had two queen size beds that were comfortable. There were.enough towels for everyone. We attended an event for the weekend and the staff kept the hall filled with water for us. Check-in was painless. The cleaning staff did a good job on the rooms each day. All in all an excellent stay. I do have to say the restaurant at this hotel is amazing. On the pricey side, but worth every penny. If you stay here, definately order the made to order pasta, and get a ham and egg sandwhich for breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for LAX”
Reviews.Author: steve375
Reviews.Content: Overpriced hotel taking advantage of the close proximity to LAX. If you must be close to the airport for an early morning flight then this place is convenient.The usual Crowne Plaza amenities, with a twist. Top Notch live Jazz in their lounge. Would have enjoyed the music if I didnt have a 5:45AM flight. Clean and comfortable rooms. All rooms ARE NOT facing the runway. Makes for a quieter airport experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's fine”
Reviews.Author: notnecessary
Reviews.Content: LAX Crowne Plaza may be an alternative for those needing to stay close to the airport. The rooms seem to face office buildings next door rather than the runways so aircraft noise was minimal. The rooms have recently been renovated, bedding is plush, beds comfortable, shower hot, big screen TV, etc. The lobby has amenities such as a sushi bar, coffee bar, large bar area and restaurant. Prices tend to be airport hotel high but our dinner in the restaurant was excellent. That is not a word we usually use toward hotel food. Additionally we received a very competitive rate via the internet. Would have no problem returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good renovated rooms and mostly good food”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel: rates are better than the Hilton where I normally stay, and just as good. I like the renovated rooms, good A/C, decent bathroom, nice bed and TV, not great sofa, but will do, lots of power plugs, curtains at the windows... Check-in lady was good and efficient, check out almost as good. Now, food: the restaurant's burgers are GREAT, really tasty. Prices at the restaurant are not cheap, but that's normal at LAX hotels. Too bad for super slow service, although polite and mostly friendly. I also got room service: very quick, but the tuna was a huge disappointment. Overcooked to taste like salmon and tasteless... Avoid it. Coffee at the Starbucks in the lobby sucks.. but I guess that depends on your coffee tastes. Shuttles are fairly frequent and a short hop from the terminals. All in all, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A real cool place for an Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee B
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza at LAX is a step above most airport hotels. They have a great Jazz club on Thursday nights and the best Sushi chef(his stand is in the lobby) I have ever experienced. I just seem to have a good time there. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms are clean, comfortable, and nice”
Reviews.Author: RulesLawyer
Reviews.Content: The letter at the front desk and in the room warned that construction may be taking place after 7:00 AM. I saw few signs of this construction, except for the time I looked out my window and saw a construction worker hanging out of a seventh floor room working on the glass. The room I checked into, on the 8th floor, was fresh, clean, and pleasant. Like many hotels, guest noise from the hallway was frequent, but not annoying. Self-parking is a little inconvenient; it's a long way up to where parking starts on the 4th floor. Water pressure was solid, there was little wait at the front desk, and the bed was comfortable. The alarm clock is complicated to set right -- if you're the kind of person who had a VCR that constantly blinked 12:00, you're out of luck. I'm a computer nerd, and finally figured it out the second night, after an AM/PM mix-up (the staff had set the clock to be 12 hours wrong). Wifi was fast and stable. My second night, I received a letter indicating that the water will be shut down for construction from midnight to 3:00 AM. I slept through it, so it didn't effect me. The pizza in the restaurant was great, but I was both surprised and amused that the only beers on tap were Bud Light and Coors Light. If I could be sure of getting a renovated room (and it sounds like they'll be done by fall), I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2012 and Pre-Judging is alive and well...”
Reviews.Author: Bam B
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Crowne Plaza Feb 1st for 1 night..Had connecting flight next morning..I normally stay @ Radisson next door but price @ Crowne Plaza was better and pics on website looked nice. .From the moment I walked off the airport shuttle upon my arrival 2 Crowne Plaza, I felt like The Brother from Another Planet..The bellmen out front looked at me as if I wasnt supposed to be there..I gathered my 2 bags and walked into the front desk area..As I reached the front desk (which was occupied by 3 female and 1 male employee, they all stared at me like maybe I was lost..(all except the black american employee)..So I walked up to the next available clerk who looked at me with a blank expression and asked, "can I help you?" Now I am a 53 year old black american male wearing a nice buttoned down collard shirt and dockers with a smile on my face...My appearance should'nt have given off any red flags of trouble..So I checked in and while I signed papers an approximately 30 year old white make wearing t-shirt and jeans approached the same lady who was assisting me..She greeted him with a smile while stating ."Welcome to Crowne Plaza sir, how may I help you?"..Wooooooooooooooooooooooooow....So I then go up to my room.... Once inside room I must say I was pleased..Great room..Everything looked fresh, new and up to date..See Pics below..I was very impressed with the room..All tho there appeared to be some construction still going on, it did not affect my stay..I then decided to go back down and attempt to reverse the negative vibrations I was receiving from the 90% Hispanic employees of the hotel, with kindness.. I contacted a doorman (ref computer in lobby that allows airport check in) and a different clerk behind the front desk to use a pencil..After me killing them with kindness there attitudes appeared to relax a bit..Except for a employee wearing a nice suit who didnt say anything but appeared to be watching all the employees and there actions.. I then went into the restaurant and sat at the bar..The bartender Temo (older hispanic male) gave me the same negative reaction as the doormen and desk clerks) As I sat @ the bar he asked if I would be eating there. I stated yes..As I looked @ menu a older white couple sat at the bar and Temo smiled and greeted them with "how may I help you"..Thru out my dinner I too killed Mr Temo with kindness and left him a big tip as well..Even tho I had to ask him twice for more water..Ordered the salmon and it was cooked perfect..Great meal..Left bar and went to gift shop... Met a wonderful Philippino couple who worked in the gift shop..I only purchased bottle water and a news paper but had a 30 minute conversation with this couple..Very nice and pleasant couple..These two are an assist to the hotel.. To sum up this review, I loved my stay at the Crowne Plaza Hotel..The room was great and the food was great..Im aware that there has been a issue/problem between blacks and hispanics in the L.A. area but I did not know that it carried into a 4 star hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Service, relaxation, comfort”
Reviews.Author: harmonyeternal
Reviews.Content: I spent about 2 hours reading reviews about hotels at LAX on priceline.com and kinda got depressed because it seemed the LAX hotels were dated, smelly and full of problems. Then I remembered a positive experience I had at Crowne Plaza in New Orleans, LA the previous year. To my chagrin, there were also some negative comments for this property but I followed my instincts and I am glad I did. I was greeted by the valet staff kindly, then the desk staff on a Sunday afternoon. Check in was quick and painless, completed in less than 5 minutes and it only took that long because I had heaps of questions. Then Manny helped me with my bags to my room and made sure everything was a-ok and he also guided me to where I needed to go to drop off my rental car. Turns out our home towns were near each other. A short and pleasant interaction. When I arrived to my room, everything was what one would expect of a 4 star hotel. I asked for a renovated room and discovered I had been already upgraded because of a membership that I have. A nice touch was a personal message on the phone (not a recorded one) checking to make sure that everything in the room was in order. I guess all I needed after that was cookies and milk and to be tucked in. I am a stickler for water pressure, so I was not disappointed when I had bathing time. The deep tub was a plus. Room service was fast and very efficient. I ordered breakfast in my room the next day and was satisfied with the service. Though I only stayed 1 night, the thing I liked most was that it was uneventful. I wanted to get sleep before a 14 hour flight and even though the airport is "across the street" and there is airport noise, I slept very well and this probably had a lot to do with the comfort of the bed. Definitely a plus, the bed. For less than 100 US dollars, this is the place. If you want to be near the airport and have a good nights rest, this is the place. If you want drama, rude staff, hassles, and more drama, stay at one of the many other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for ...”
Reviews.Author: nativsurf
Reviews.Content: I didn't choose the hotel,but rather Priceline chose it for me. Following it's choice I read many reviews and the one thing that was noted -- ask for a renovated room as they were considerably nicer. Upon arrival I kindly asked for a renovated room (read flat screens, upgraded amenities, etc.) but was told I could enjoy a renovated room for an additional $30 charge! Are kidding me? You would think they would want to give you the finest experience possible. Definitely not a room w a tube TV from the 1990s.... sadly still here and straining to see my TV. As well, unlike most hotel chains these days they charge for internet ... so I write this review from my phone!

Reviews.Title: “lovely service”
Reviews.Author: CeeBeeCt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Thursday, Feb. 23. Best price available at LAX; extremely nice people. I was given a room that was so recently rennovated that it still smelled of paint and all the fresh textiles which stimulated my alergies; the extremely kind manager was able to move me to a room which had not yet been rennovated but was none the less very nice and comfortable even very late at night and when the property was almost fully booked. Very good shuttle service in the a.m. to airport terminal. The dicey freeway situtation in LA makes it sensible to stay at the airport before an early morning flight and I will go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: loridieckmann
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room were excellent, but breakfast at $18.95 is overpriced. As a Priority Club member, I received a coupon from them for a drink in the bar or a Starbucks. That was a very nice perk. My one huge complaint was that their one and only kiosk for printing boarding passes had a note hanging on it stating "out of toner" when I checked in at 3:00 pm. The note was still there at 7:00 am when I was leaving. A Big problem for an airport hotel!!! The employees behind the desk were very kind about it, but I left without a boarding pass. They couldn't have went shopping to buy some toner????

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: I work out of town 5 days a week and stay at different hotels in each city.I've stayed here for 2 months while working in LA.They have a very accommodating staff. Close to airport. Rooms are being updated as of Jan 2012. Very clean

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, desk staff need to try harder”
Reviews.Author: InsideTrack
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times while on business in the Los Angeles area. Let me start by saying that it appears they are doing some renovation to the hotel, which is a plus. The place was starting to look a bit dated. Rooms are like-quality to some of those in Waikiki (rundown, disrepair) but the last time I stayed there the room was awesome and seemed to have been fixed up. I usually book directly with the reservations person at the hotel and she is awesome! The check-in staff however, have ALWAYS been miserable, unfriendly and impolite. Definitely need to fix that! There is a great little bakery in the lobby featuring Krispy Kreme and the restaurant is good too. Beware of parking gouge. $13.95 per night self-park or $23.95 for valet. And in that neighbourhood, you probably want valet so prepare to be gouged. Definitely ask for a room away from the runway, otherwise your view and sound all night will be of planes taking off and landing at LAX. My mistake the first time. Also, this place does not offer free Wi-Fi like the rest of the modern, hotel world. Definitely a knock against a hotel of this calibre. I recommend this place if you are looking for somewhere safe and clean in the Inglewood area.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Staff that make it so good”
Reviews.Author: irloyal
Reviews.Content: I travel A LOT. I'm a Priority Club member and visit a lot of IHG hotels. The Crowne Plaza's are usually very nice but the one at LAX is a little unusual. Here's Why: 1 - It is a pretty old and dated hotel as far as Crowne Plaza's go. The place DESPERATELY needs an update. Construction is starting on that and it is going slowly. 2 - It is a little noisy being only one block off the northern runway of LAX. 3 - It is probably the best staffed hotel I visit on a regular basis. EVERYONE is professional and pleasant. From the maid staff to the front desk and conciege, all have been nothing less than professional with me and many go beyond what is required to make you comfortable. 4 - Finally there is TONY. He is a wonderful combination of waiter, cook and concierge who runs the club on the 16th floor. Tony is really the reason I return here 2X a year for the meetings I attend at the Sheraton . Make sure you either stay on the 16th (execuive) floor or make use of your Priority Club status when you stay here. Good Stuff: If you enjoy a view of LA lights at night, most rooms have some sort of view. The food in the restaurant is always good, not superb, but good consistent food. Try the pizza's. The staff is top notch and it is convenient as it gets for access to LAX. Wireless internet is good. (I'm using it now) Not so good stuff: The rooms are decidely average. Old TV's, carpet, furniture, phones etc. There are better equiped rooms at most Holiday Inn Express, but I hope the re-model will fix that. Perks: The Club room and Tony. Free Jazz (really good too) on Thursday night.

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied at all”
Reviews.Author: doudou15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza 3 nights but trust be, I made quite a few hotels around the airport and I think it was one of the worst. The noise of the outside was terrible. I could write the schedule of each plane arriving and departing during the night. You can also hear the noise coming from the street so I didn't sleep much during those nights. Also you have to know that when you travel with a child and that you need 2 beds, your room will systematically have a connecting door with the next room. The first night we had the pleasure to be woken up by our 2 neighbor girls at 3 am, they were just back from clubs. They were drunk and despite the fact that we knocked on the door many times they spoke very loudly until 5am ... we were sooo angry !!! They told us they would make an effort for the following night but when we changed our room it was really the same ! The rooms are quite old and small and the mattress uncomfortable. The only good point is the starbucks in the lobby and the choice of 3 restaurants (Japanese, Italian and standard), but as you may know you can find this in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest Services And Thursday Night Jazz Scene”
Reviews.Author: gary c
Reviews.Content: I have always received great service at this hotel. The front desk staff is most accomodating and willing to consider my needs. Thursday night stays provide an opportunity to attend a jazz set in the lounge...free of charge. The best value in town. Would also be remiss not to mention specifically Tony, who in and of himself is a reason to stay at this hotel and Mr Spates who is a manager par excellence. My appreciation and continued patronage to both

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hernandezmm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, very nice. It is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a layover from Chicago to Asia. Even though I arrived around 1pm the front desk staff let me check in early. The shuttle is pretty on time, and the driver is helpful. But the room has definitely seen its better days. Even the hotel is close to the runway, I can barely hear the planes landing or taking off.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms great, food terrible”
Reviews.Author: SteveNGini
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight before a.m. flight out. New 10th floor room was beautiful, newly renovated. Dinner was a disappointment. Server was surly, and food was just OK. Caution, If you are leaving early on a Continental flight, do NOT expect to get anything decent to eat at LAX terminal 6 or 7. Eat somewhere else and then catch the shuttle

Reviews.Title: “Front staff not friendly nor did they listen”
Reviews.Author: JuatTravelingThrough
Reviews.Content: Just checked in after a long flight from Taipei. While in Asia I stayed at a couple of ICHotels properties. This one can't hold a candle to them in terms of service. I asked the lady--must have been a long du for her--who did not even greeted me nor did she looked like she was happy to see a guest. I asked if I can be upgraded as an Ambassor gold member. In this property, the upgrade will have been on the 15th floor. She put me on the 11th floor. She handed me my key--no welcome, no have a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & pleasant hotel for Business stop-over”
Reviews.Author: Markadlz
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum member of the Priority Club, I always look for the "Holiday Inn" options and was pleased with this Crowne Plaza choice. Good location near LAX, friendly and helpful staff and great refurbished room with fantastic bed! Use of 16th Floor Lounge and free internet much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Under Renovation, Surprise in the desk”
Reviews.Author: rwoman11
Reviews.Content: I'd read existing reviews (quite variable) and knew that the property is currently being refurbished. PC Platinum Benefits: - Two very desk agents were friendly and immediately greeted me. - Received an upgrade to the Club floor. - Complimentary breakfast buffet ($18.50) - Drink in the coffee shop (I got a small, but could have ordered a larger drink). Check-in: Very prompt and I was on my way up to my room. Room: As stated, they are refurbishing this property. My room was very large and had a nice view, buthad not been updated. Pros - very comfortable bed/linens (slept great); four great pillows; variety of TV channels; free bottle of water; good shower; excellent hair dryer; top floor of the hotel. Cons - badly stained carpet; duvet was worn and frayed; toothpick lying next to bathroom trash can (not my trash); went to the desk drawer to see if they had stationery so I could mail a letter and found Trojans instead. Amenities: - Wifi - the hotel charges $10.95 for 24 hours of Internet. The coffee shop in the lobby charges for wifi (cheaper with drink purchase) and four PC's available at a minimum $5 cost. I was surprised this served as the business center. - Restaurant/coffee shop - I visited the restaurant for breakfast. It is an extensive buffet with a combination of hot items, fruit, pastries, muffins, etc. The coffee shop serves a variety of coffees, danishes, muffins, bagels, Krispy Kreme, and to go items. - Gym - the gym had treadmills, bikes, ellipticals, free weights, and machine weights. Small, but very functional. - Airport shuttle - there is a free shuttle bus that us used by multiple hotels. At 630am, it was full and some had to wait for the next bus. One thing I want to mention... My family drove me from dinner and shopping to the hotel. My sister waited at a red light to make a right turn onto Century Blvd - it was hard to see oncoming traffic because of parked cars, so she waited at the red light for a green. The shuttle driver behind us laid on the horn a lot since she waited, which I'm pretty sure is legal; I did not know it would be the same driver that pulled up in front of the CP as we unloaded my bags. We were along the curb unloading my stuff and the bus lays on the horn again...claiming it was not us he was yelling/honking at when I approached him to ask for a minute to get my stuff. He said it was the other car...which was unoccupied, so his honking was not going to help move it anywhere Anyway, as a customer I thought this was really unprofessional ... perhaps an open trunk and me taking out my belongings was not obvious. I've stayed at CP properties in London, Atlanta, and NYC. Of them, this is the most dingy (room wise, the facilities were fine) I've stayed in, but they are re-doing it. That said, I probably would not stay here again until the refurb is done or I would go with another PC property...likely one with free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for intransit”
Reviews.Author: KoiSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights after flying from London to pick up cruise ship. Allowing us to check out L.A for a day. The hotel was part of a package for the cruise, When I read the reviews for this hotel before travelling I was not shore what to expect all the reviews were very negative. But am very pleased to say the rooms were clean very large bedroom,the bathroom was OK The bar was OK for a drink and bar snake, also you could get a light breakfast, or use the restaurant for a cooked meal. Yes the whole hotel could do with a make over but for one or two nights its fine. The staff were very helpful especially the concierge

Reviews.Title: “Great for conference”
Reviews.Author: Rachel F
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here and the amenities were wonderful. Room was clean. Staff was friendly. Easy access to LAX (free shuttle), plus affordable public transportation taking you to fun LA sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Rooms refreshed. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dspiller_rotary
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay after Hawaii. Stayed in a refreshed room. Slept great even with a little airport noise. Overall great stay. Much better than other HI properties in the area

Reviews.Title: “Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Carol H
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are amazing and very attentive to your needs. Very conveniently close to airport with a free shuttle. Recently upgraded, the rooms are clean and large with lots of space. I would stay there again in a LA minute!

Reviews.Title: “If you get stuck at the airport, this is a nice refuge”
Reviews.Author: jtreby
Reviews.Content: Nobody stays at an airport hotel unless they have to, and that was the case for us recently. Our flight was delayed for maintenance issues and the airline offered us the option of staying overnight and taking a different flight in the morning. They put us up here. The front desk staff were very professional, obviously accustomed to dealing with weary travelers. The check in process was smooth and efficient, our room was well appointed and the bed was extremely comfortable. We were on the airport side of the hotel, we could hear some jet noise, but it wasn't so loud as to keep us from sleep. We used our vouchers in the morning for the breakfast buffet, which is pricey, but we were able to get eggs cooked to order as well. The coffee was good. There is a less pricey eatery available in the hotel for breakfast and light food that we did not take advantage of. The free shuttle is an added bonus. We left the hotel refreshed and ready to take on another day of travel!

Reviews.Title: “staff do not listen”
Reviews.Author: Clinton G
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here, arrived late, hotel near full and received a good welcome informed staff paying cash, but still gave credit card as requested. On check out told my card had been charged but would recredit it back. Imagine my dissappoinment when I open the mail to find the credit has not gone through. I prefer to pay cash to save the foreign bank service fees. It will be interesting to see if the hotel refunds the fees as requested. I am a hotel owner of a 4.5 star hotel and this is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hotel, Staff Uncaring”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: 10 minute wait times for the front desk, before hanging up. Went downstairs for a simple restaurant recommendation, the front desk guy sends me to a bellman. It wasn't busy, this guy was just lazy. Work being done everyone, this joint (better word than hotel) is a mess. Business Center? 4 computers with credit card swipe built in, right in front of the snack shop. Expensive to access the internet, Plenty more... This experience continues to disappoint and now disgust. My room had no book explaining hotel amenities, workout area location, etc. The TV is ancient, but color. Most of the towels are so wrinkled, I'm not using them (are they clean? Probably not). No bath mat for the shower. THEN, the toilet was not flushed. That's right, use your imagination. So the housekeeping team is as bad as the front desk team. Disgusting property. This all reflects on leadership. Crowne Plaza can't hire the right people to hire the right people? Horrible experience. Go next door to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Would look at other options.”
Reviews.Author: Genuine37A96
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for four nights. Purchased room through priceline for a good rate, however was told upon check in that could not ask for "extras" when staying with these discounted rates. The "extras" refer to a remodeled room. Be prepared for Parking at $23 dollars a day and wi- fi $10 a day. This hotel has a very nice lobby. Pros- The room was clean but clearly dated. The floor was quiet. The staff was friendly. They brought a mini fridge and towels quickly upon request. Cons Do not look for a flat screen or a place to dock your ipod if staying here. The bathroom needs to be upgraded as well. The fixtures and parts of the base boards were cracked and the tub did not drain well. Had to keep requesting extra towels. Two towels and two washcloths a day are just not enough for two adults on vacation. The brunch is not worth the money it costs. I have had better brunches at the best western which were included in the cost. The food was luke warm -if that,and there were very few choices. This isn't a bad hotel for a one or two day trip however I would not personally stay here again. Although the cost is slightly higher at some other area hotels, after parking, internet, and breakfast, you wind up paying about the same.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annie8848
Reviews.Content: Very nice, large room with King bed, flat wide screen TV, clean. Great Park and Fly rate. Close to airport. One warning--the parking area is not owned by the hotel but is run by--I think it was called--QuickPark and is public parking. We had forgotten our handicap placard in our other car so we left the paper print out verification in the window and was towed. Guess they couldn't read. Sandy, the concierge at the hotel was great helping us to locate our car.

Reviews.Title: “The cleaning staff was great... everything else was awful.”
Reviews.Author: jetsetroadbound
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an example of a company that doesn't even try anymore because they know people will just keep coming. They know that, being near an airport, weary travelers desperate for some shuteye will come stop in no matter what. Even their comments to people who have posted reviews here seem to simply have been copied and pasted by some drone. I used Hotwire (on my brother-in-law's recommendation) for the first and last time here. Firstly, it turns out the discount I received was actually far less than advertised, they seem to have just jacked up the price on Hotwire; and secondly, I felt like I was being treated as a second class citizen because I tried to be thrifty. I understand that you can't always expect the same level of glamour when trying to save a few bucks, but to be poorly treated by a major hotel chain? That's appalling to me. I was traveling with 3 other people (myself, a friend, and a couple), and we were shocked by the size of the room. The beds were too small for the couple to sleep comfortably, let alone for two grown men to share. We asked for a rollaway bed, but they said they couldn't because it was a fire hazard which seemed odd to me. I'm not saying that they were lying about it, but I have never had a problem getting a rollaway bed in similar establishments in California. The front of desk's only recommendation to me was that I consider sleeping on the floor if I wasn't comfortable. I had to leave that conversation I was so upset at those childish remarks. I was polite and rational, and I was met with hostility and sarcasm. My friend, who is admittedly over emotional at times, almost cried at being treated like that. What really irks me is that the room was clearly set up for two people. Two towels, two cloths, two individual shampoos. The desk staff said that they simply give rooms to Hotwire who then fills the rooms, but they could at least maintain some communication with Hotwire to ensure that they're ready to welcome your guests in a professional manner. But nope, they just passed the buck and kept telling me things that they "couldn't" do instead of finding a way to resolve a situation. Thanks alot though to the great members of the cleaning staff who were helpful and friendly. You guys deserve alot better.

Reviews.Title: “Middle-of-the-road airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: catherine c
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to meet up with family. It's very convenient to the airport, situated on the main road into LAX, maybe a mile or 2 from the Terminals. It's relatively convenient to Venice/Santa Monica/Manhattan Beach but that is still at least a 30 min taxi ride ($40 and up). The immediate surroundings are as expected-long term car parking, cargo areas etc. Nothing to walk to and not a good neighbourhood to walk in. Shuttles to the terminals about every 20 mins with a screen showing where they were, which was useful. The pool is tiny, up on the 2nd or 3rd floor and seemed to be in the shade most of the day. The newly renovated rooms are a must-they're actually pretty nice. Sound proofing worked well, although you do hear the planes a little but they didn't keep me awake, it was a white noise. There's a restuarant and bar on site, not too bad, but a bit pricey for what you get (and where you are.) Staff were friendly and helpful. Would I stay here if I had a long layover? Maybe. But I'd also take a look at the new Custom Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dependable, close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_737
Reviews.Content: One night stopover (again!) on AKL-LHR trip. Good beds, polite and helpful staff, free drink for Priority Club members, good restaurant. Close to airport with a free shuttle. I usually stay here at short notice and would happily recommend it. I have never been bothered by noise from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A standard, value for money, airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: Normally when nightstopping at LAX, I'd stay in the Hilton or Marriott, but both were charging massive amounts of money - so I booked in to the Crowne Plaza for $100 less than either the Marriott or HIlton were charging. There was a long line at check in, which I was able to by pass thanks to my newly acquired Gold status with Priority Club. That did not stop the reception agent barking at me that I needed to be a Priority Club Elite member to use the special desk - once I confirmed that I was, his manner improved considerably. I was upgraded to the Club floor, with access to possibly the smallest Club lounge I have ever seen - I tried to use the Club for breakfast (apparently there is continental available) but it was so busy that I elected to walk up the road to Dennys. Probably a less healthy breakfast, but at least I got some exercise with the walk! My room was fine - nothing special. The TV remote was a bit shonky, but the bed, whilst firm, was comfortable and I slept well. Even after travelling from London, the comfort of the bed prevented me from waking at 5am like I normally do on my first morning in the US. When I did awake, I was able to use the free wireless to catch up on work. The bathroom was OK. The bath tub demonstrated my pet hate - one or two stray hairs from a previous guest were present....nasty! Towels were fluffy and soft, and amenities were generally good. Only generally, because the coffee in the coffee machine was the same nasty coffee I experienced in a previous stay in a Holiday Inn in Front Royal (see previous review). All in all, for the price paid, I could not really complain. Make sure tubs are cleaned properly, and enlarge the club lounge, and the score would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money is about all I can say !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: willi68
Reviews.Content: Firstly, their website photos must be 20 years old !!!!! I was put in this Hotel due to the cost by my business travel consultant due to cost but I wished Id paid a little more for somewhere else...The pluses, free shuttle to / from the airport, staff very polite and helpful and the food not too bad to be honest.....now the bad news...Decor and rooms from the 1970s and not been refurbed since...the noisest hotel ive ever stayed in...bearing in mind close to the airport the rooms are not sound proved..you hear every aircraft taking off from 5am to 11pm...aircon unit was like bomb going off everytime it fired up so switched it off so i could sleep...carpets and upholstery stained, torn and dated..The doors are made in such a way they slam shut everytime so you hear every door closing in the proximity of your room....In a nutshell, pay a little more and stay at the Marriott or Sheraton one block either side.......

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: invisalia
Reviews.Content: We had to run down to Los Angeles to take our daughter to the airport. We asked for a double Queen room and they had one. The room was pleasant, comfortable, clean and fashionably decorated. Very nice. I had free drink for being priority. Parking costs, but most places charge for parking in these areas. It was overall a nice trip. Beautiful hotel with amenities including gift shop, hair salon, lounge, restaurant, sushi bar, coffee shop, guest services, concierge, valet parking etc. Close and easy to the airport with a shuttle as well.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Dated, Gross Rooms! See Pix”
Reviews.Author: Licorish
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a hotel. I attended an event entitled "Rock Your Curves" back on Nov 17-20th which was hosted at the hotel. When you walk in the first impression is deceiving, the lobby and front desk are nice, clean and in order... but the room was in absolute disarray. They were "out of king rooms" so I had to keep the horrible one I was given. To make up for it they only comped my parking. Here is the list of issues: - Completely OUTDATED room looked worse than some MOTELS I've stayed in - Stained Carpet - Filty stained floor in the bathroom, the grout was so dirty it looked tan but in the corners was white. - Filthy windows - Peeling Paint off the walls! - White crusty stains on the navy blue velvet (YES VELVET) chair (eww I can only imagine what those stains were!) - Scratched up wood on the armoire that boxed the OLD as DIRT bubbleback TV - BLOOD stains on the white comforter! - Stained paper lamp shades, each of them looked like they had been urinated on - The DIRTIEST IRONING BOARD I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY LIFE!!! I had a White dress to iron and was afraid to use it. SEE PICS TO BELEIVE IT!!! Please, DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!! RUN FOR THE HILLS AND STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE! I WISH SOMEONE HAD WARNED ME. All they did was free parking to make up for this disgusting hot mess of a hotel room. They shouldâ€™ve reimbursed my stay and given me a new stay in one of their handful of updated rooms. This hotel should be shut down by the health department! Stay at the nearby Renaissance Inn or the newly remodeled 4 Points Sheraton LAX (MAKE SURE YOU GET A RENOVATED ROOM, I had a bad an experience at the 4 Points Sheraton LAX too but the GM more than made up for it, giving me a stay in a new remodeled room which was amazing.) â€¢ Stayed November 2011, traveled on business

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Room and Staff”
Reviews.Author: lancewest
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, and have turned in to a total hotel snob. This attitude is limited by my company's bean counters who insist that anything above $150.00 for a nightly hotel room charge is robbery. I have never understood why the hotels around LAX are so expensive, especially when one can stay on the beach for the same money, but that's another story. So the LAX Crowne Plaza is very nice. Newly remodeled rooms (make sure you ask for one, not all are done yet) are top of the line with great furnishings and colors. I came in just under $150.00 before taxes, so my accountants are happy. More importantly, the staff was outstanding. This is not a typical Crowne Plaza (a.k.a. badge-engineering an old Marriott) and should be on the top of anyone's list at LAX. One caution - the hotel shuttles run on the half hour at LAX. That's a hell of a long time at midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: cyberdudeAustralia
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here at this hotel twice. Once ten years a go and I dont think the hotel has changed since then. It is however fine for a 1 night stay before catching a flight home. The location is perfect for the airport but not the best area to walk around. Luckily we had a car to drive to near by places.The hotel does have a decent pool and gym for those interested in that. Staff were friendly except for the one that checked us in. I asked about parking but he didnt tell me what I needed to do, just figured it out myself I did get a 5pm check out whichh was perfect for us as we had a late flight. It did cost $50 but was worth it. Overall I would stay here again for a 1 night stay before flying back home.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite crowne plaza nice”
Reviews.Author: Stokesfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything negative to say about the hotel, although the room was dated and in need of remodeling. The staff was pleasant and the room was clean. I've stayed at a few crowne plazas and this one was not up to par with the others. Will look for a nicer hotel next time in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night for late arrival.”
Reviews.Author: ITravel4Business_12
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Club lounge should be open and available 24/7. Unfortunately had kept hours. Weekends closed. Security should be visible at all times at entrance of parking garage due to abundance of street people walking down lane and entering parking structure. When security was visible no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Only for a few hours.”
Reviews.Author: jmsharpe
Reviews.Content: I was put here by delta after being bumped, so I didn't pay for the room and I'm glad. The hotel is undergoing a renovation and man do they need it. The carpets were filthy, the Bathroom fixtures were crusty and I don't think the sheets had been changed. There were several people checking in who had also been bumped and the manager was not happy about it, and I was only staying for a few hours to catch my flight, otherwise I would've asked for another room or lest altogether. I went to the lobby bar and was going to ask what time they closed, since it was 10:15 and before I could even ask, the waitress was looking annoyed and checking her watch. Ok I get your extremely unsubtle cue. The bar didn't close until 11:30 but I didn't stay since she seems to be so annoyed. The only good things are 1 proximity to airport and 2 free shuttle to airport. With so many other hotel options that are close that also have shuttles, there is really no reason to stay here, at least until their renovations are completed. Definitely not a Crowne Plaza level room as it is now.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Crowne”
Reviews.Author: austinwinters
Reviews.Content: Keeping with tradition, this review will be written in sections in order to keep everything neat and organized. This is my second stay at the Crowne Plaza LAX and up to this point I did not know how to appropriately rate this property. Both times I arrived at the hotel quite late at night and had an early departure which did not leave much time to get the full experience. I will say that I enjoyed both of my stays at the property but it really started to cement the thought that most of the Crowne Plaza properties that I have stayed at are getting very dated. Please keep in mind, I stayed at this property over a year ago and they may have refreshed their property since my last stay. Table of Contents Looking for a particular section? To use the table of contents use the "Find" functionality of your browser. Press "CTRL and the letter 'F'" on your keyboard and type in the numeral which you would like to go to. For example, CTRL+F and "ii." will take you to "Air Transat Flight". i. Booking ii. Airport Transfer & Check-In iii. The Room iv. Club Level v. Conclusion (i.) Pre-Booking --- Booking the room was quick and easy as it always is with ICHotels group. Not only were we able to book a room on the Executive Floor, they also charged the same rate for the same room on a standard floor. Excellent touch! Excellent reliability with PC points to book the room. (ii.) Airport Transfer & Check-In --- After a very long day of flights we finally touched down at LAX at 00:30 and took the long taxi towards the terminal. Finally getting outside of the airport at around 1:15 it was time to wait for the airport shuttle. Surprisingly, there was not much of a wait! About 10 minutes of waiting curb side for the shuttle it showed up with "Crowne Plaza LAX / Raddison LAX" on it's planned route. The bus ride was another 15-20 minutes as we navigated the cars around the terminals and drove the maze of roads onto West Century. Arriving at the hotel provided a quick and easy check-in experience. The reservation was already prepared and without any delay we were on our way to the elevator to swipe our card to get to the CP Executive Floor. On the previous stay being on a standard floor meant having to share with a travelling youth band. As you can imagine they weren't the quietest bunch. The only thing we heard on the floor was the ding of the elevator when we arrived. The Crowne is close to the airport. A quick complimentary shuttle ride away. (iii.) The Room The room was comfortable. We were located on the West side of the hotel with a view of the LAX tarmac (something which I had requested in the reservation). The room was your average Crowne Plaza style. Two double beds with the Crowne Plaza red pillow for decoration, a working desk and television. The room needs an update, there is no doubt about it. From what I have seen on the other reviews there is a refresh program that is starting to pop up throughout the hotel; a welcome change indeed! Bathroom was clean and once again a standard Crowne Plaza room. Good amenities, great water pressure. No complaints at all. As with the bedroom, it also needs a refresh. (iv.) Club Level --- If you are on the fence on whether to upgrade to the Club level, just do it! On the first stay we opted out and stayed on a standard floor with significantly more noise and traffic. The second time, we upgraded and were very happy we did so. The primary reasons were the quietness of the floor and complimentary continental breakfast. The area around this hotel is barren. The only place to get something to eat within walking distance was snack food at a VERY sketchy convenience store. The breakfast in the morning was fresh and offered a large amount of different pastries, juices, and coffee. Even for an extra $10 it's so much more worth it then going to the "store" or waiting to pay through the roof at the airport. Note: I am not a very frequent user of Executive level services. To me it was perfect, but to other seasoned business travellers it may not be the same experience. (v.) Conclusion --- As the title says, it was an average Crowne experience. I don't expect the Crowne brand to be grand in any sense but it should live up to it's name as an upscale business traveler hotel. I can't say that if I have the opportunity to stay at another Crowne I would "jump" at the chance, but I do know that they hold a quality product that is a little dated. As with this property specifically it is comfortable, close to LAX, provides an airport shuttle, and will give you a good night sleep. If you aren't tied to Priority Club and earning through them I'd say take a look around the area and see if another property really attracts you. If you're looking for an average CP property near LAX, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Expereince ... every time”
Reviews.Author: a m
Reviews.Content: I have travel to LA 5-8 times a year for the past 3 years (for business) and have stayed at this hotel almost every time. Last time (Dec 2011) was another great experience. Some of the employees in the restaurants make me feel at home and have the highest sense of customer service (Oreen, the host and occasional barista; and Miguel - restaurant server at dinner time). I keep staying here because it feels like home away from home. I have NEVER had a bad room. Twice I got a room with not too good of a view and the front desk promptly gave me a different room. Being a priority club member probably helps, as I occasionally get a "free" upgraded room and other small extras. Yes, the restaurant is a little pricey, but convenient. There are many fast food and casual sit-in restaurants within 5 miles that are better priced. I will stay there again every time I travel back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “QUIET ZONE”
Reviews.Author: terrynkathy
Reviews.Content: Executive level offers serenity! No kids, no slamming doors, peaceful and quiet. Quiet is mandatory on the E.L. E.L. offers evening reception and a very upscale continental breakfast with hot items. Key access only to executive level guests. It is similar to airline private hospitality rooms. The lobby is very pretty, but don't think your room will look as nice. Never does! Charge for parking, located directly next door. We felt the vehicle would be secure, no worries there. Customer service is superb. Rooms are nice but not Luxurious. I would upgrade to this level but not if it cost more than 40.00. I have only stayed on this level so cannot comment on standard rooms. There have been times they upgrade us at no charge. Have stayed there 4-5 times and would continue to stay there. Complimentary shuttles to LAX are clean, on time and reliable. I search for the least expensive rate and most of the time crowneplaza.com will have the same price. I believe staff must maintain the E.L to a higher standard as I do not experience stained carpets, or run down. The bathrooms could use re-tiling on the floor. No balcony. Food is expensive and I have not eaten there. Join Crown Plaza Rewards and they treat you even better. Late check out is automatic unless they are booked solid. I have always received a 2pm check out. Love the E.L. amenitity kit, including a few things like linen spray and eye mask. Linens are much nicer as well. Staff has always been very attentive and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, worn out rooms”
Reviews.Author: nanaglo45
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is very convenient for quick access to LAX with a frequent shuttle, but the rooms themselves have stained carpets, torn draperies, nicked furniture, etc. The beds, though, ARE comfortable. If I stayed again I would pay the higher price for a refurbished room. I am a Priority Club Platinum member and I was put on the concierge level floor which is the top (16th) floor. Nonetheless, these rooms have NOT been refurbished and were very disappointing. The hotel has not responded at all to my complaint made with Priority Club, though I was told I could expect to hear from them and it has now been six weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Quick and Efficient Service, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarkLaurence
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for a night in transit from Hawaii to new York. The free shuttle service is quick and efficient and the hotel very close to all terminals. Check in was a breeze and the hotel room was fantastic - king size bed with large flat screen TV and great views of the airport. The bar and brasserie was okay although a couple of drunk Americans made it a bit unpleasant so I returned to my room. The voicemail checkout system is great. I walked out of my room the next morning and the shuttle was waiting to take me back to the airport. All in all this was a great choice - the hotel seems to have a range of excellent facilities as well like sauna, steam room, hotpool and swimming pool, gym etc but I didn't have time to use any of them. The wireless in not free but reasonably priced. I would recommend the Crowne Plaza if you are having a layover between long flights - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but don't expect to sleep much”
Reviews.Author: lovetraveling6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we had an early flight the next morning. The location is fantastic, right at the entrance of the airport and there is a free shuttle from the airport to your terminal which was great. Unfortunately the beds were double and not queen size, so trying to fit 2 average sized adults on a double bed was not so easy and I ended up sleeping on the floor which was much more comfortable. The walls are seriously paper thin.....you can hear EVERYTHING and I mean everything from the adjoining rooms...again thank goodness for earplugs, which were kindly provided by the hotel along with an eye mask. The hotel provides wifi at 3 different rates, I can't remember them all, but I only needed to get on quickly so only had to pay $2 for 10 minutes which was great, instead of having to pay for a whole 24 hours. Our room was nice and modern and clean with everything we needed. We got a cheap deal on the internet so it was a good price for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie_Torres
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend and I was expecting to hear a loud noise from the planes (since, it's really close to the airport) but I was so wrong. My room was great, service was excellent and the room is way too nice! I want to special mention 3 people: 1.) Baman (the person who checked me in) = He was awesome and has a very good customer service. 2.) Miguel = He was awesome and very patient especially when my 3 year old daughter keeps on running all over the place. 3.)Dinesh (Manager) = He is one of the best manager I've ever met. I really recommend this hotel!!! If you are looking for a great stay, great food, great price and unforgettable experience, you should stay in this hotel! Again, Thank you so much for the wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: lixiaojc
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Old and worn in. For the price I expected more, and was really disappointed. The rooms were all beat up and torn looking (Two Rooms). The glass overlooking the airport was disgusting and probably had not been cleaned for months. The carpet was gross looking. The staff was ok, as I did complain and they did switch rooms but they were all pretty much the same...Oh but I could of spent $20 more dollars for a remodeled room? Only one floor is nice apparently? I wish we would of stayed at a newer property and can't see why any one would pay that money for those rooms. You could get the same quality at half the price at a cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: debra60143
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Well accessible to where you need to go. Food rather pricey but you can get around that if you don't mind walking. Will be glad when I can go here again! Had a wonderful birthday treat from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Park And fly”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night and this included 7 days of parking, I would say this property needs updating. There are a lot of choices near lax and I would not stay here again. The bar was decent and had good service. The room had satined carpet and the hallways were very noisy. Had to wait 15 minutes plus at the airport for the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your ipod so you can listen to Blondie in your filthy, retro 80's-style room”
Reviews.Author: BeckyandMike
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews on this site when checking in we requested one of their renovated (upper floor) rooms. Nieta at the front desk REALLY couldn't have been less friendly. I don't normally like to single out individual employees but this hotel would have to work pretty hard to find a less welcoming one. Nieta coldly (and a bit smugly) informed us that the AAA rate we had booked didn't entitle us to a renovated room even though plenty of renovated rooms were available (smirk). We went upstairs to our room only to discover that the keycards she gave us didn't work so right back down to the lobby we went. Even though we had checked in only three minutes earlier and she had been the one to give us the cards that didn't work, Nieta still made us produce identification before re-issuing cards that would work. It was so ridiculous that we just had to laugh. Our room, however, was no laughing matter. AAA/discount customers beware: you think you're getting a discount here but what you're really getting is an inferior product: stained, disgusting carpet, furnishings that have to be 25 years old, a t.v. from the early 90's, a tired bathroom with filthy tile and an air conditioner that sounds like a freight train. This place was pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “A good airport hotel (if there is such a thing)!”
Reviews.Author: Douglas A
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel on our way in and out of LAX. It's an airport destination; I've seen few families staying here and that's probably because there are more family oriented hotels closer to the touristic sites in the L.A. area. On my last stay in August 2011, our daughter drove up from San Diego to see us off. She has a three year old an an infant and as we entered the lounge to have a drink and appetizer I noticed the waitress view us out of the corner of her eye as she stood at the server counter visiting with the bartender. We chose a table at the back where we would not bother any of the guests, though there were few. We didn't get waited on so I eventually had to get up and go ask the waitress to take our order. Service was tendered but with an attitude. Not a family experience! Rooms are adequate but I've always found the bathrooms - and I've stayed here a number of times - to be dated. The upside: beds are comfy and the pillows are so good I ordered some. The dining room is laid out around a central buffet but you can order from the menu. Meals border on average but I've never been disappointed with the service during breakfast or dinner. The wait staff in this restaurant go beyond the call of duty and I'm never reluctant to leave a generous tip. Curbside parking valets are friendly and efficient. Finding a valet to carry luggage to your room can be problematical, though, and on more than one experience. I checked in one night and found a college age valet standing in the lobby with nothing to do but not meeting the shuttle bus at curbside. I finally got his attention and got my bags to the room. I flipped him a $20 bill to help pay for his education and told him next time to pay attention to arriving guests. But this is really management's job. On another occasion, I made reservations on line (I'm a Priority Club member) for my wife and when she checked in they weren't going to give her the room after traveling over 20 hours from the Middle East because she wasn't me! If they had scrolled down on the reservation they would have found the notation that she would be arriving late and checking in in her name. My wife received an apology from the manager the next morning, but she was wondering where to go at that late hour due to an obstinate young desk clerk. I have stayed in other LAX hotels but always find myself preferring the Crowne Plaza due to its location and its sleeping comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Patricia P
Reviews.Content: I should have listened to the negative reviews. We didn't book through a travel website, but directly with the hotel with a senior discount and still got a terrible room. The girl at check-in was rude and not friendly. The room was the worst. The carpet was dirty, dirty, dirty. The furniture was old and worn. I slept in the chair most of the night because the bed smelled like urine and the bathroom had mold in the shower. People were yelling in the halls at 4 am and I could even hear the woman next door sneeze! Room 322 needs to be shut down, closed off and cleaned up!! You shouldn't ask a guest who is paying well over $115 to sleep in this disgusting room!! Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Crappy room, non-existent noise insulation”
Reviews.Author: Alex S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap, but there has just gotta be better options if you need to stay at LAX. The room was very worn down, carpet was falling apart, furniture looked like flea market finds, but those are all things you can live with. What was not okayvwas the lack of noise insulation. When we got into the room the guy in the next room coughed, and it sounded like he was just next tous. And what even worse was that we woke up several times during the night from noice outside, in the corridor and from neighbouring rooms. Before our stay here we had been to Venice beach, west hollywood and Catalina and in none of these places we had any issues woth noice so we are not at all picky. I also travel quite a bit in work and have never stayed in a place that is more worn down and non-insulated in any western country.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet, great LAX option”
Reviews.Author: NickB1979
Reviews.Content: This is a great airport hotel. It's quiet, very clean, decent rooms and price is not too bad. Easy to get to on free shuttle. Very little aircraft noise. Service at reception was a bit slow and buffet breakfast not the best but overall recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Great Value, and Clean- will return.”
Reviews.Author: Atltraveler607
Reviews.Content: PCR Member, stayed in late Sept. 2011- business. Very professional staff from the minute they take your car. Valet staff was friendly and accommodating. Front desk was quick and professional. The hotel is very well equipped with "starbucks-like" quick cafe, mini travel store, in house full restaurant and CP owned bar with short order food. I got one of the remodeled rooms, and it was clean and large, with an extremely comfortable bed. Internet is Free (for anyone, regardless of PCR status). The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom. It was remodeled, but has a very small sink area extending from the wall, and the shaving mirror is designed for someone less than 5' tall, and it doesn't tilt. It was placed low on the wall, toilets also were small and low to the ground. Executive lounge was in need a remodel with an old style tube tv, but the food, and service in the lounge with Tony was excellent!!! Would stay again. Excellent value for less than $200/night in LA. (very little plane noise after 8pm, and remember this is near the airport, so some noise is to be expected.)

Reviews.Title: “My new go-to hotel for LAX”
Reviews.Author: jaaronfarr
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about this hotel when I saw other rooms, however, my stay has been great. Granted, I have priority club gold status, so I was upgraded to a "VIP" room. These rooms are exactly what I expect from a Crown Plaza - clean, modern, comfortable. My only complaint was a lack of a mini-fridge. I can imagine experiences vary significantly depending on the room you get, but for me, it's not a question any longer. This is my go-to hotel for LAX and the west side of Los Angeles now.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely airport hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: HuskyAK
Reviews.Content: This is wonderful hotel in the Priority Club lineup that offers a bit more in room, restaurant - bar, and amenities. Everything was terrific, however, for those desperately in need of sleep, bring earplugs. I've never been in a hotel with such a loud transfer of noise from the hallway and other rooms coming through your front door. Also, maids start banging on doors at 700am and vacuum the hallways at the same time. Other than that great place to stay and the restaurant great too!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room and excellent dining facility”
Reviews.Author: Mary N
Reviews.Content: The front desk host was very friendly and helpful. I had a great dinner in their dining area of fresh salad bar consisting of wraps, cheeses, and meats. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and Great Sushi”
Reviews.Author: Spencer K
Reviews.Content: Was only there one night but the staff seemed very nice and helpful. The Priority Club room was great for happy hour and breakfast but the best was the Sushi bar in the lobby--amazing dinner and I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: AASP
Reviews.Content: The pick up from the airport was ok. The check in took quite sometime. I guess the resort is getting renovated and I was lucky to get a newly made room. I didn't find the staff very responsive. I am not sure if it is really value for money with Radisson etc near to the Crown Plaza and I was getting the them at the same rate (got inclined to CrownPlaza as I am a priority club member).

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: Filthy room, unhelpful front desk staff, the worst customer service ever (especially if you are a third party booking). This hotel should be a one star, and maybe not even that in the older rooms. Not worth even the most discounted rates. Rama at front desk takes his job of denying all requests for help very seriously. Stay away form this property..

Reviews.Title: “Nothing great....”
Reviews.Author: sandyjb83
Reviews.Content: Got a reasonable price here as it was the same price as the holiday inn for a sat night stay. First, there is no priority club elite line, just a priority club line so you can imagine the line will be long. Kinda pointless if you have status, you are better off waiting in the general line as it moves faster. Only one person is manning the priority club member line. Waited almost 15 minutes to get checked in. Got "upgraded" to the club floor (16th floor) as a PC Platinum. Not entirely sure how this is an upgrade since the lounge is non operational on the weekend. Dont know if this is normal and if all priority club lounges are closed over the weekend. Room was seriously outdated. Looked quite old, and honestly the Holiday Inn around the corner is actually nicer than this. Wouldn't give me an additional breakfast voucher either (ok fine,so its my fault that I made a reservation for 1, which is what I do by default) but the guy at check in could clearly see I had a companion and had requested 2 beds. Still wouldn't give me an extra breakfast voucher or drink voucher, and told me I could purchase it instead. Not much benefits yet for having platinum status. Also parking is $14 in case you are not aware. The plus: great location if you have a flight to catch. Did give me check out at 3 PM since I had a later flight. Bottom line is that I wont be staying here anytime soon though...

Reviews.Title: “Great location; good value”
Reviews.Author: MaryMcCartney
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel through Hotwire and after reading reviews, I was apprehensive, to say the least. However, we had a very pleasant one night stay before our flight out of LAX. The bellhop who carried our luggage both on arrival and departure was cheerful and efficient. We were also pleased with the speed and courtesy with which we were checked in. While our room was obviously not yet upgraded, it was spacious and clean. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: mxtravelingirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived to LAX almost at midnight. We quickly found our way to the hotel transportation area. About 10 min later we saw the Crowne Plaza and Renaissance shuttle. About 15 minutes later we were checking in with no problem. The room was clean and comfortable. Next morning we had a breakfast voucher and had the breakfast buffet. It was good, but wouldn't have taken it if we didn't had the vouchers, since I felt it was a bit overpriced. But there's a small cafe/deli in the lobby too, if you want something cheaper. I find this hotel perfect for a night stay before or after a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Quite honestly the worst accommodation I have ever stayed, backpackers offer better quality”
Reviews.Author: Dion K
Reviews.Content: Just don't know where to start with this one, was the most awful experiences from start to finish. Waited for over 30 minutes in Priority Club queue, there was only one person on the desk but two staff were very visible out the back and although saw me did nothing to expedite check in. Sheets on bed appeared to be used, towels in the bathroom had â€œbodily fluidsâ€� on them and both the bathroom and the room did not at all seem clean. Was there for 3 days, during this time carpet from my room to the lift was covered in crumbs and dirt and did not appeared to get vacuumed at all. I needed a bottle opener; called room service, the bar and the front desk no one could find a solution. Called the duty manager who didnâ€™t seem too interested but eventually, and begrudgingly, she arranged an opener for me. I complained to the duty manager about the experience in cleanliness and the overall quality of stay and was offered a $5 credit on a previous purchase at the bar. If this is how ICH treat their most valuable guest then I will be steering well clear of them in future.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Dineric
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel via a "Bid" on Priceline.com. We stayed one night and flew out the next morning. My Bid was 100.00 and that was for a standard room. Upon arrival we were offered an upgrade to a "Renovated" room for an extra 20.00. Of course we accepted because it offered extras like a big screen, pillow top king bed, and a few other tweaks. Well worth the extra 20.00!!! We had a lovely room with a decent view. We will definitely stay here again next time we are in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “The tructh about this budget airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: grouchob
Reviews.Content: Came here on the day that New York Airport was first closed because of the impending hurricane attack. We were sent here by the Continental staff at LAX. Expected the worst- an extra 2 days in a budget airport hotel before flights to UK! Then the reality- a great hotel- pretty basic room compared with others we had stayed in, but a good price and great facilities including freshly cooked food at any time of the day. Outside there was a great bus service to the fabulous Manhattan Beach which we used for both of our extra days in LA. I can't understand the negative comments. This was a great hotel with a reliable complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport. We had great food, and a very enjoyable forced extension to our US experience. Many thanks Crowne Plaza!!

Reviews.Title: “Same place, different date.”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Mingle
Reviews.Content: Nothing extraordinary about the hotel, kinda dated. I bidded for a room on three different occasions and each time was given the same room on the 5th floor at the end if the hall. I don't know if its specifically reserved for 'bidders' but it seems to be. Imagine my surprise the first time I stayed there to discover a $12 plus per day parking fee. So what I thought was a great deal for the room wasn't really.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is epitome of a stereotype airport hotel”
