I'm not sure if our room had been renovated or not...hope not. It looked like it was in a time warp. Also, there was a missing picture from the wall and a huge black mark was in it's place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with nearby public transport to beaches”
Reviews.Author: scousemouse
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel, located on Century blvd, one of many on the Los Angeles Airport (LAX) site with a regular free shuttle service to the various terminals which means that the traveller does not have to rely on taxis. The rooms are of good size, comfortable, reasonably well equipped, have comfortable beds and a generous bathroom with ample towels and toiletries. Despite the proximity to the airport we found airplane noise was not a problem. Breakfast was very nice, if not a little pricey, with a good selection of cooked food, oatmeal, pancakes, fresh fruit, juices and teas. The main problem with this hotel, and the others on the LAX site, is the lack of alternatives for eating and drinking â€“ and as a result of this, lack of competition which means prices are fairly high. With some searching, alternative bars and eating houses can be found which offer decent fare at reasonable prices â€“ but they are not, at first, obvious. The local bus company runs regular services to Santa Monica and Venice Beaches from the nearby bus station at bargain 1$ fare and Manhattan beach and Manhattan Village Shopping Mall can be accessed in daytime via the trolley bus (5$ return ticket available in the hotels for this service) which stops near all the main hotels. We recommend that both types of transport are used, if you have a few hours to spare â€“ spotting oceanfront locations made famous in various TV programmes and films.

Reviews.Title: “THEY ARE MY FAMILY AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: ClydeKadiddlehopper
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the LAX Crowne Plaza Hotel for 7 or 8 years, an average of about 2 nights a week. They truly are my family away from home, and all the customer contact people have become my friends - they truly do take care of the customer and make them feel like family. I love their new make over work!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Grampa Fred

Reviews.Title: “stayed for layover..ok..but needs work”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelernamaste
Reviews.Content: not horrible but crowne plaza name should be better than this...dirty in spots and really needs new things all around..great location for airport run in morning though..

Reviews.Title: “Good LAX airport reliable shuttle”
Reviews.Author: dougkuzo
Reviews.Content: Good room. No business center??? Computer use .25 per minute in the lobby. They make an affordable real brick oven pizza (Big 16" for $16) in the lobby take out. The pizza was a total surprise as it was wonderful. Shuttle was efficient. Overall slightly above average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for early morning flight; Otherwise, avoid until renovated.”
Reviews.Author: mjk8371
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on a $52 Priceline bid prior to an early morning flight out of LAX. That's the only acceptable reason for staying at this hotel, at least until the renovations that are just beginning are completed. We arrived around 8:30 pm and were told that the only remaining rooms were "Smoking" rooms. Were they ever! As soon as the elevator doors opened, the stench of stale cigarette smoke nearly overwhelmed us. My wife and kids would be writing a much harsher critique than I am here. The carpets were dirty, the room smelled and overall it's badly in need of renovation. But on the other hand, for a simple night's stay close to the airport at a decent rate, it will suffice. I slept well and the airport shuttle got us to the airport on time. HOT TIP: If you're staying here and wish to leave your car for an extended period, purchase parking for the Airport Center lot on cheapairportparking.org. We paid less than $6 a day for the same lot the hotel charges somewhere around $20/day. This deal far surpasses any "Park n Fly" deals offered by the Crowne Plaza as well.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, conveniently located, shuttle service, excellent food.”
Reviews.Author: Zoeann
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and were pleasantly surprised by the dining menu. Varied and excellent choices and very delicious. Room was very nice, comfortable bed. Some remodeling going on. Helpful staff. Would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Survivable”
Reviews.Author: Conscientia
Reviews.Content: I was sent here by Delta Airlines when my flight from LAX was delayed. Rooms I stayed in a standard double room, which was a reasonable size but had seen better days. It was reasonably quiet despite proximity to the airport, and I got a decent night's sleep. Public areas Sterile and efficient looking, basically what you'd expect from a Crowne. The upstairs hallways are dark and look a little dodgy. Food I ate at the main hotel restaurant, which was OK but overpriced. There weren't many vegetarian options, but they have a cook-to-order pasta which was passable. Breakfast pancakes were quite good, though vegetarians be warned - they come with unexpected bacon! Espresso was well made. For the price of the meals I would have expected much better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but could be quieter”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel as a result of a bid of $57 ($72 total with taxes/fees) bid through Priceline. Ã�t is not quite at the level of the Sheraton Gateway and Hilton hotels nearby, but is more or less equivalent to the 3-star Radisson down the street, though at the Radisson we got free Internet (Crowne Plaza charges $10.95, whether in your room, business center or public areas, and I declined) and I heard a bit more airplane noise from the room at the Crowne Plaza (virtually every room faces the airport runways). The restaurant looked okay in terms of selections but, not surprisingly, lacked atmosphere, so we dined at the Encounter Restaurant in the middle of LAX. Hotel's location is fine. Concierge/ball captain desk personnel were helpful. I probably wouldn't hesitate to return, especially at the Priceline rate, except for the airplane noise (I did manage a decent night's sleep with ear plugs, and my wife was not bothered much).

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: StephMW10
Reviews.Content: How does this hotel get away with saying that it is three and a half stars? I've stayed in nicer two star motels. Everything is old and filthy. I was given a smoking room (my guess is because I paid through Hotwire). I asked if they had anything else but was told no, so I figured it wouldn't be too bad. Wrong. I could barely breathe. The room smelled worse than a Vegas Casino. I don't even think a smoker would stay in that room. I kept the window open all night (that's right, the window actually opened). It was so overwhelming and disgusting. The carpets and walls were dirty, the television picture was blurry and there was dirt in the sink and shower. I wouldn't even pay Hotwire's low rate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stress free LAX parking”
Reviews.Author: SantaClaritaWinedog
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that my wife and I have availed ourselves of the Crowne Plaza's park and ride package. The hotel provides a spacious, comfortable room, and up to 7 days of parking at a reasonable price. The concierge level is worth every cent of the additional cost, giving you a room on that floor, and access to the concierge lounge, which provides a hosted beer and wine reception, from 5:30 to 7:30, with enough food to constitute dinner. At 6AM, the lounge provides a perfectly adequate continental breakfast. The lounge is masterfully hosted by Tony, who flawlessly sees to everyones needs. When getaway time comes, the efficient shuttle takes you right to the terminal, on a 24 hour basis. We have tried most every LAX parking venue, but nowadays, when we fly from there, Crowne Plaza is our first choice as an option that takes the stress out of air travel.

Reviews.Title: “A good quality hotel, rooms in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Ty00
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2010. The main reason for me choosing the hotel was due to it's airport location and complimentary shuttle bus as I was on a late arriving flight. The public areas of the hotel are clean and welcoming, if a little dated. The front desk staff were extremely efficient and helpful on check in and a credit to the hotel. I had upgraded to a club level room located on the highest floor of the hotel. Whilst the room had all the basic facilities it was most definitely in need of refurbishment. The carpet had several stains and the walls were marked in several places. There was a letter in the room explaining the hotel rooms were undergoing refurbishment, this is much needed as the rooms are very dated and not what you would expect from this brand. Room service was quick and efficient, all the staff are encountered throughout my stay were friendly and courteous. If all of the rooms are being refurbished I would definitely stay at this hotel again, although I'm not sure the additional supplement for a club room is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm, not the hotel for an extended stay of for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: DamianBelfast
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine if you're just staying there to be close to the airport. If you're there as a sightseer then stay downtown. I stayed here for 3 nights in total and I thought I was in a backwater town. There is nothing around there apart from a Burger King and a Dennys and a few 7-11 type stores, which are all quite a walk from the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable but nothing special. Not what I expected from Crowne Plaza at all. Saying that I did get a very good price through hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza LA has it all”
Reviews.Author: cleidesantos0
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Hotel staff and accomodations, easy access to airport and to the Manhattan Beach, cute lobby and adorable bar & restaurant in site, our room was spacious, unbelievable quite considering that we stayed at the airport area and for our surprise we found at our bed a welcome cute dog made of a towel. Thanks to Channa, our stay could not be any better then this.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: Sharonp1953
Reviews.Content: The rooms were okay, no complaints there, but I was told I had been upgraded (as a Platinum member of IC Hotels this is automatic if available) but I had not been upgraded at all. Later offered a discounted room rate to compensate. Advised to walk to car rental, even though I told them I was recovering from broken leg, at least one mile walking distance, although looks less (in a direct line). The staff were not at all efficient. I am still, nine days later still awaiting information about something lost/stolen from my car. Really poor response to this problem. I would only stay here if I had no other option.

Reviews.Title: “Great price with Priceline, Room was dirty with mold”
Reviews.Author: sue_1007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than once. This past time I really noticed the bathroom mold on the ceiling. They have no fans in the bathrooms, which I guess over time have produced mold. I spoke with the front desk but they did not seem worried, I asked them if they could try and clean it, they did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing nearby if you have to stay for a while”
Reviews.Author: ally0911
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel for an overnight stop but nothing else in the area

Reviews.Title: “What a complete hole!!!”
Reviews.Author: DnDAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night.got room 622. The beds were nice and neat but that was about it. The room looked like multiple frat parties had taken place in the room. I ended up wearing socks and shoes most the time as I did not want to step on the carpet. Outside of the lobby the entire place looked like it could do with a complete makeover. Between the dingy carpet and the nicks and drag marks on the wall The staff had attitudes and would rather you leave them alone than help. Save your money and stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick stopover”
Reviews.Author: Novocastrian_Ash
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here to break up my travels between Australia and the US. After scoring a room on Priceline for US$45, I came in not expecting a lot. The free shuttle to/from the airport was great, and I believe it runs constantly. Check in was ok, though I was quite disappointed there were no offers of assistance with my luggage. The room was nothing special, and a little dated but it did it's job. I had a king sized bed which was amazing and there were plenty of tv channels to choose from. I do have concern regarding the thoroughness of the bathroom cleaning as there were wrappers on the ground under the sink at the back but the toilet and shower seemed clean enough. I had a room overlooking the airport which was great though there was obviously quite a lot of noise associated with this- but choosing an airport hotel you do expect it. The hotel also seems to be the choice for many of the airlines when staff stay over. Overall it was a reasonable experience, what one would expect from an airport hotel and if you are only needing somewhere to sleep for a few hours between flights then it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at a Great Price for a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bargain_Benno
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which does not look too much from the outside. The rooms are a bit tired but OK. The beds are good. It is quiet and there is minimal noise from LAX. There are a range of food places in the lobby area and they do a great wood fired pizza with lots of cheese. The reception desk is helpful. The Lobby shop also handy. I have heard that some people find this place noisy but we have not found this. The spa is heated but the pool I am not sure on. It was cold when we were there but people were in the pool. Excellent regular shuttle to the airport. Walking distance to hire car companies and food places. Also a good local store nerby for milk etc. Would stay there again. Check out www.priceline.com as they use this hotel a lot for "mystery" hotel sales.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CherieL_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there with 2 friends. We flew in from Australia and were flying to Montana the next morning. It was important we had somewhere comfortable and quiet to relax after the long flight. This was perfect. They were doing the hotel up when we were there but that did not interfere with us at all. The rooms are spacious and spotless. The pool and spa were great. The bedding was awesome. Very comfortable and relaxing. The staff were great, couldn't do enough for us. The hotel had a shuttle to/from the airport which we needed. The hotel is a bit of a walk to any shops but not an impossible walk as we did it. There is a Denny's a couple of blocks away with pretty good food.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you can get a good rate...”
Reviews.Author: foofighter1981
Reviews.Content: Wound up getting this place for a second time via Priceline... good experience for the most part, and definitely a no-brainer if you have an early flight out of LAX. Couple bummers-- parking is extra ($13 a day, includes in/out privileges), internet is extra, food is pretty expensive and not that great. Guess we should be grateful there's no resort fee (yet), which seems to be the new trend with hotels nickel-and-diming us. There's quite a bit of plane noise, which could be a deal-breaker for light sleepers. If you're visiting LA as a tourist and price is your primary concern, this hotel is definitely worth considering if you can find a rate well below $100. Otherwise, there are plenty of competitive options along the 405 in West LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel looking shabby”
Reviews.Author: baglan
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to hotel - short shuttle ride from LAX. I have stayed at this hotel previously but it's looking a bit run-down now. Beds are comfortable and rooms a reasonable size. I wa stroubled by some late night aircraft noise but that may be more due to my jet-lagged state, using the room a sconvenient start point after arrival in LA from London. Buffet breakfast is OK but hot food of limited choice and not too hot - I would have preferred a meal cooked to order but it was not offered. Concierge floor is good with free drinks and snacks and WiFi internet included - a good value deal. Rental car locations only a short walk from the hotel therefore ideal for morning pick up. I booked with Hertz which is the furthest away - approx 15 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for an overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: Aussietourists_9
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on wotif.com and got it at a good price. It is a more expensive hotel normally being a Crowne Plaza, but I was surprised at the carpet and some of the fittings looking old for a Crowne hotel. Not that those things worry me because we usually stay in 3 star hotels especially if we are only there for the night. It was clean and comfortable and there was a variety of food choices downstairs. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The free shuttle was my reason for choosing this one.

Reviews.Title: “Apparently much better if you're a PC member”
Reviews.Author: bilz
Reviews.Content: I stay here from time to time on business and I've noticed most of the bad reviews come from priceline customers. If you book through priority club (use the entertainment card for a good rate), you're on one of the top floors with free high speed internet. Parts of it do look a bit dated, and it doesn't compare to $200/night hotels, but for the price and location, it can't be topped. My only complaint about the hotel is that the parking garage is old, ugly, and since 90% of the spots are labeled as compact, it can be hard to find a spot at times since everyone is forced to doublepark and take two spots. I have a compact car and even that fits between the lines with only an inch or two to spare, which means you can't open your door if someone is parked next to you. There's another lot not associated with the hotel across the street, which might be a better option..

Reviews.Title: “Oh my what wonderful beds”
Reviews.Author: ita360
Reviews.Content: The bad: pay internet access really? The good: location to LAX, shuttle (every 20 min), clean nice rooms, the most comfy beds EVER! Made it really difficult to get out of bed. 24 hr staff. Bakery/coffee shop at hotel. (great to stop at while waiting for the airport shuttle).

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: lizfonti
Reviews.Content: Paid $74 per night and stayed here on recommendation of a friend and she was right. It's only 10 mins to explore the beaches and so much cheaper than the city or beach location hotels. Our room and bathroom was immaculate and although we overlooked the road the sound proofing was excellent even though ear plugs were supplied they were not needed. The other thing supplied was a linen spray which was strange but so handy as we had been travelling around California for 10 days and our cases were a bit wiffy. The beds were amazingly comfortable, one of the best sleeps I've had in a hotel for a long time. Took advantage of the laundry room which was very reasonable at $1.50 to wash and $1.50 to dry a huge load. Staff/service was generally very good as was the cleanliness of the public areas. Free fitness centre which my son took advantage of, basic but perfectly adequate especially as we had been paying to use this facility at the other hotels we'd been staying at. My only gripe was the breakfast buffet which was quite poor in quality and choice. The second day we decided to order from the menu but almost gave up the will to live waiting for it to arrive but it finally did after the third request. It would also be nice to have a pot of tea and a decent choice of black teas rather than a cup of hot water which goes cold very quickly. Although the cup of hot water does seem to be the norm in the US.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the Crowne Plaza LAX for a...”
Reviews.Author: rishi_parwani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza LAX for a night for a long transit. A very basic hotel but also very convenient for transits. The rooms were very cosy but could do with a but of updating. Overall, a very nice experience. I'll be back if I need to transit in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Best Business hotel close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: cjosephi
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel whenever in LA for 25 years . The people are great from Mike payton the GM to Denise Lowe my Sales Person to Tony who works in the 16th floor Priority Club . The price is right , great restaraunt and bar ( jazz on Thursday nites ) and only minutes from LAX by shuttle . Excellent for the price !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price”
Reviews.Author: micanthony76
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here to pick up my husband from the airport and look around LA again. Everyone here was wonderful and asked if I needed anything when they saw me, The beds were extremely comfortable and soft. The hotel laid out a little bedtime bag on the bed, which inlcuded earplugs that I did not need. We spent the next day in Venice which is a very close driving distance. I would rather stay here and drive to Venice than pay the Venice hotel costs. They have something for everyone; a pool, hot tub, valet service, self parking for a fee, a gym, and restaurants. The rooms and bathrooms are both nice sizes and the 3 of us were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “One nighter only.”
Reviews.Author: GeordieViking43
Reviews.Content: Typical big city traveler's hotel. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Decent sized room with an excellent bathroom. Food selection from the deli bar in the evening was very poor but surprisingly the breakfast buffet was excellent. The main attraction of this hotel is that it's close to LAX and to the car hire companies. One good point was that we didn't notice any noise from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “convenience only”
Reviews.Author: 409mom
Reviews.Content: chose to stay for the convenience of shuttle service and due to our late night arrival to LAX. Staff was professional only, not going out of their way for anything, I felt as though I was interupting them. The room was clean, air stale, room hot from no air circulating, I am just happy we could open a window and lucky the outside temp was cool. We did expect noise as we were near the airport, but that was minimal.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good rate, it's good deal”
Reviews.Author: GoSeeCal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for 2 nights (Fri/Sat) in May. We got a $59 rate with our Entertainment Card. We though it was a good deal. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It has been probably ablut 5 year since the rooms were updated, and it could use another update, but it's still in pretty good shape. The beds were very comfortable. The two drawbacks are: 1) you have to pay for internet service and 2) you have to pay for parking, which is in a parking structure that is not attached from the hotel (so it's a bit of a hassle to come and go from the hotel). Still, if you get a good rate, these are minor quibbles. The location is near LAX. It's great if your travel involves the airport. Otherwise, it's a bit remote from most stuff in LA that you might want to do. But if you stay on a weekend and have another person in your car (which gets you into the HOV lanes), you can get downtown pretty quickly--about 15 minutes. Traffic into and out of downtown was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Fine - not as bad as the reviews say!”
Reviews.Author: wafam66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this room through Priceline and got a great deal. After reading the reviews, I was extremely nervous that we'd be staying in a dump for a few days! It was fine. The staff at the front desk were helpful and the room was clean - nothing special, but we were just there to sleep and shower, and it served that purpose just fine. I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend paying the going rate, but would certainly recommend if they got a good deal on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: poppyredScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as an overnight stay before catching our morning flight, rooms were not clean and very outdated through out the hotel, did not have the rooms available that we booked and was offered an alternative on the smoking floor, which was unacceptable when you have children but did nothing to rectify their booking error. would not use or recommend this hotel to anyone. very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: jeanr
Reviews.Content: Managed to get for fairly good price on Priceline, wouldn't want to pay rack rate. We checked in early after flight from Australia, the front desk staff were very good. We asked for a quiet room with 2 beds which is what we got, beds were very comfortable, bathroom was clean. The rooms obviously need renovating, the carpet was stained and was damp, so think it had just been cleaned. Parking was across the street and cost $12. We were given discount vouchers for breakfast, and the breakfast was good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel for stopovers.”
Reviews.Author: floralsydney
Reviews.Content: Not expecting too much from an airport hotel, we booked the Crown Plaza for an overnight stay enroute from Australia to Ft Lauderdale. We were extremely tired and so we were pleasantly surprised with the quiet & and spacious room we were allocated.. A large comfortable king bed with soft pillows and block out curtains ensured a good nights sleep, and the large bathroom with decent sized vanity and shower with supersized showerhead was a bonus. We ate at the restaurant downstairs which had a variety of excellent food at reasonable prices and there was a pleasant bar/lounge area with live music. We could have happily stayed a few more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Much better alternatives in close proximity”
Reviews.Author: samsdadOrlando_FL
Reviews.Content: Won(?) with Priceline bid. Asked for 2 doubles given Handicapped King. Dirty matted carpet, iron burns on rug included. Thread bare towels, extremely noisy neighbor in the middle of the night. Some airport runway noise. OK bed. Good shuttle service. Stay away if paying regular rates!!

Reviews.Title: “Place needs a huge renovation”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: When I first got to the hotel, I was impressed with the lobby. Nice tile floors, a couple restuarants, just a big city feel to the place. However, when I got to the rooms, well, what a dump. Carpet was stained all over the place, beat up bathrooms, stained walls, antiquated TV and loud AC unit. I travel extensively for business and this was arguably the worst room I have stayed in. The only bright side of the room was the bed, which was comfortable. I can't believe Crowne Plaza would let their rooms this bad. Especially in a high profile city like LA. If it was not for the lobby, I'd give it one star. I did get it for $50 a night on priceline. Not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Ziplocked
Reviews.Content: We just wanted a hotel for one night to recover from a long plane ride, so we booked the Crone Plaza through Priceline, thinking it was a nice hotel. In fact, it was worth what we paid, which was 50.00 for the night and that included free transport on the hotel shuttle from the airport. The hotel is typical of what you find at airports, large buildings with lots of rooms, none of which are really any good, because nobody is staying there for very long. Everything in that hotel had a tired look, the lobby, the staff, the room, so if you aren't tired by the time you get there, just entering the hotel should do the trick. Of course, with that many rooms, there is plenty of coming and going, lots of pilots and crew to wow the kids as well. For food there is a selection of fast food places within walking distance and extensive order in menu via telephone. But really, you are only there to sleep, and that we did well, so I guess its mission accomplished for the Crowne Plaza. Considering what we paid, I'm not complaining.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: euscarol
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby area is nice when you walk in and check in. They have a nice coffee bar and small sushi area in lobby area. When you go up to your rooms the carpet is old. In my room the carpet is old and faded. Hallways and room smell a little musty. The wall paper has stains on it. My room was noisy so I asked for another room. I was told all the rooms are noisy because it is by an airport. They had housekeeping deliver some ear plugs. The chair at the desk is old and wobbles. The air/heat unit is one of those old ones that is on the side of the wall...kind of noisy. The pools is closed for renovation and not due to open until July 1. The fitness offering is a gym next door for a $10 fee. Parking is $20 for valet or $12.50 next door in a multi-story lot. I won't be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: mochaberry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Crown Plaza on February for personal trip. the service was great and people were friendly. there was alot of thinkg near by. also they were couple of food truck for lunch. for the value, everything is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Good value for LAX stopovers”
Reviews.Author: cpagia
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice on arriving and leaving from LAX, booking via priceline to get very cheap rates. The hotel shuttle is pretty common for hotels here, but good to have nontheless. Rooms and beds are as you would expect, comfortable and clean and the restaurant area does a good wood-fired pizza. Lack of free internet is annoying, although 2 hours in room (wired, no wifi) is only $1.95 If you're here for a couple of days and like the beach or shopping there is a trolley which takes you on a round trip for $3 and can happily fill in a day. There is also plenty of cheap car hire around if you want to drive further afeild.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear, this poor hotel needs some TLC ASAP”
Reviews.Author: foxyboo
Reviews.Content: Look we were desperate when we booked this hotel. The snooty hotel we had been staying at in Beverly Hills couldn't offer us a late check out and we had 10 hours to kill before our 15 hr flight back to Australia. We simply needed a shower and a nice bed. Check in was nice enough, though it was obvious as soon as we walked in that this IHG property has been largely ignored. It's circa 1990. It was a godsend to get to our room and the room looked clean, but the furnishings of the room are hideously tired, the furniture is chipped and the wallpaper was literally peeling off the walls. The internal A/C unit is huge and loud and forget watching planes fly in, the windows are so filthy you can't see out. I also haven't seen a big old bubble TV unit since 97. Having said all that, when you are tired and anticipating a long haul flight, you'll take a hotel room of this calibre anyday, and it does a great job. Stay here longer than 24 hours, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “stains everywhere”
Reviews.Author: aaflyerincali
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of major cleaning. The hallways were stained, there were countless stains on the carpet in the room, the chair was stained. Walls were marked up, etc. The service was fine, but the room didn't feel clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Dabu35805
Reviews.Content: I bid this hotel from priceline. I read all reviews about this hotel before my trip. Be honest, it made me pretty upset. Well, it turns out not bad. The front desk is slow but the staffs are friendly. Parking and internet are not free. Neither does Marriott or Hilton. Room is clean. I have to admit, furniture is a bit old, but it is clean and tolerable. Aircraft noise is not an issue to us; maybe because our room faces the street. The hotel does provide ear plugs. Hotel didnâ€™t provide tooth paste and brush. Called them around 9pm but no one answered phone. Had to call them again at Morning and got tooth paste and brush pretty quick.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: CatherineSNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here between flights. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. A gift pouch with items for the plane was on the bed. The shuttle was convenient. The breakfast buffet was good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: Carol0143
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at the hotel. For both times, I got a price of $45 at priceline. Bed is very comfortable. Bathroom is large and clean, and the shampoo is OK. We stayed at very south end of the wing, and the noise from airport and from Century Ave can be bothersome. But the AC is even louder, so... Hotel provided us with one pair of eye mask and ear plug. Parking tips: if you come back hotel late and will be leaving before 9 am, you can consider park your car on the street at the back of the hotel. Parking is free 9 pm-9 am, but there is a two-hour limit before midnight. You can save $12 this way.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: TaniaJ
Reviews.Content: For the first time ever I made my hotel reservation through hotwire and did not know what hotel I was getting until after the purchase occurred. I needed a hotel in the LAX area for a weekend conference. There were 3 possibilities that matched the offer for 3 Â½ stars for $59 a night and after researching online reviews I was really hoping I would not get the Crowne Plaza for my reservation, but I did. I dreaded my stay and pre-requested a quiet, clean room with a king bed. Upon my arrival, I was surprised to find the staff to be friendly and helpful and my requests noted in my reservation were granted. They gave me a room in the â€œquiet zoneâ€� with a king bed and a small pull out sofa. The carpet was stained, the outside of the windows were muddy and the tv & furniture was outdated as mentioned in other online reviews, however the room was QUIET and the bed was definitely comfortable. The room was clean other than the carpet and the daily cleaning service was efficient. I personally would not take a bath in the small tub, but the shower had a massaging head and the curtain was curved out a bit as to make it less confining. I parked in the self parking lot (a reasonable $12 a day or something like that) and was able to walk to my conference at the Hilton in 15 minutes each way. The breakfast buffet was a good deal with the 50% off coupon given to me at check-in and seemed to be a popular choice. The outdoor pool was the smallest pool I have ever seen and the chairs did not have cushions on them but the sun was shining down on the woman taking advantage of the facilities where-as the rest of the area was still overcast. I did not use the pool, hot tub, fitness room, sauna or steam room but it was nice to know they were there just in case. I did try to get a drink from the drink machine that only takes credit cards. After the machine on my floor did not work, I went to the next floor. It took my credit card but did not give me a drink (twice). There is a number to call and get a refund but I have not called. I did get a drink coupon from the lobby when I reported my issue. There is a convenient trolley that loops from the LAX hotel area to Manhattan Beach regularly for $5 round trip. Buy the tickets at the front desk and enjoy. I felt safe and relatively comfortable during my stay and they allowed me to have a late check out. I would rate this hotel at 3 Â½ stars max because it really needs an update in furniture, carpet and pool. I would recommend this hotel as long as you are not looking for a 5 star glamorous resort-type get-away.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised. Great service, great breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: MamaOpe
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on here and other sites I was very worried, about our stay. I got the hotel through priceline and did not know what hotel it was until I booked. It was considered a 3.5 star hotel. We reserved a room with 2 double beds and a crib, since we were traveling with our 6 and 2 year old. When we got there they only had King rooms. I was disappointed until they showed us the room equipped with a king bed, rollaway bed and a crib. It was a real crib (white metal) not a pack-n-play. It actually worked out better since the rollaway was closer to the floor and a twin size bed. I will probably ask for this set up on future hotel stays. The room was old, but very clean, and the beds were very comfortable. The tv was old, but that did not bother me. The rooms were cleaned very promptly (like by the time we got back from breakfast). The staff were very pleasant and accommodating. I would definitely stay there again, for the priceline/hotwire etc. reduced price.

Reviews.Title: “A very tired hotel....”
Reviews.Author: SWEnglandTravellers
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Crowne Plaza LAX following a flight delay to the UK. We stayed for 3 nights and this was relatively unpleasant. The hotel is unlike other Crowne Plaza's we have stayed in previously and appears to have been forgotten about. It is in serious need of modernisation and refurbishment in the communal areas and the rooms. Our really low points were as follows; Our room was dull with old looking furniture. The windows were dirty and one did not shut properly which caused noise difficulties from the nearby runway & flight path. The ancient aircon unit rattled and the pipes vibrated through the wall to the next room (even if ours was switched off!). This noise was 24/7. Whenever the room above us ran their sink water or shower we found water coming into our bathroom sink and bubbling up in the sink pipes. The walls to the rooms were thin and we could hear people in the rooms either side talking. The outer bedding did not look particularly clean and the beds were not so comfortable. The restaurant is relatively dark with just a few windows that look onto a smoking courtyard. Again, the furniture and decor is tired and does not appear inviting. Our second visit to the restaurant was a real turning point due to the delivery of some bread and butter to our table by a waiter, which was accompanied by a long thick black hair woven through the butter scoops. This was utterly disgusting and we were in disbelief that not only had it been placed there by whoever prepared it but that it had also gone un-noticed by the waiter. It was clearly obvious and we immediately questioned the overall restaurant hygiene. We pointed this out and cancelled our food order, although the staff did not seem that suprised. Needless to say we did not eat here again. Good points; Either side of the hotel are the Sheraton and the Marriot. They are both very nice with relaxed yet smart restaurants. We spent a fair proportion of our spare time at the Marriot which has a nice lounge with free wi-fi (rare in LA), a Starbucks and great menus and service at the two restaurants. Breakfast here is certainly recommended also.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to Lose Its Crown”
Reviews.Author: Chicago Flyer
Reviews.Content: I thought that the Crowne Plaza label was a higher-end hotel chain for Intercontinental (which inclludes the Holiday Inn brand). Well, I was wrong with this place. It is a low-end Holiday Inn in disguise - no crowns for this dump. I was here for one night only since I had to catch an early flight at LAX. Check-in - unprofessional - nothing went wrong but the clerks were behind the counter having graphic personal conversations Parking Garage - I realize it is not managed by them but they have a sign out front directing you to park there so they have an interest in its appearance, the elevator is filthy, pieces of the formica has fallen off the elevator wall, the ceiling panels are missing - makes you wonder about the mechanical capabilities of the elevator. Halls - walking to our room, small pieces of trash on the carpet, doors slam shut - with a hotel that is going to get people in/out at all hours to catch flights, they should have a better door set up that don't slam. The door to the room next to us slammed and literally shook our room. Room - filthy carpet (full of stains), chipped furniture (desk, entertainment cabinet), no safe in room (expected for a hotel in my opinion), small bathroom with extremely low counter - needed to bend over to wash up (and no, this was not a handicap room), old TV (not an updated HD flat screen). Pros - location close to the airport, I got a very good rate via Priceline. BUT, Priceline rated this as a 3.5 star hotel - NO WAY - more like a 2 star. I have not stayed at other hotels near LAX but they have got to be better than this.

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain for airport layover”
Reviews.Author: eddotcom
Reviews.Content: While we might not feel so favorably disposed toward the hotel had we booked it at the hotel web's rate, for the amount we paid on a priceline bid, it we would call it a great value. Pluses: Â· Room size. Our standard room was approximately 240 square feet, including the bathroom. Â· Beds and bedding. The beds were comfortable, of medium firmness, with a fitted bottom sheet and a top sheet which was not tucked in (eliminating the need to remake the bed when the bedding is pulled from beneath the mattress). It had both a blanket and a thin comforter, giving the choice of a light or heavier cover. Â· Black-out curtains which worked. A clip for the gap between the curtains was provided--a nice touch. In case the very small amount of light coming from the bottom of the curtain is troublesome, they provided a courtesy kit which included an eye mask. Â· Location. If you want an airport hotel, this is very close to LAX, with a courtesy van picking lodgers up from the airport about every 20 minutes. The "ocean blue" vans are easily spotted from any of the terminals. Minuses Â· The room air conditioner is similar to the old below-the-window units, complete with the perpetual drone of the fan. The courtesy kit with the eye mask also contained ear plugs. Â· The tube television is housed in a huge armoire, making the room feel smaller than it is. Â· The cultured marble bathroom counter (complete with cigarette burns) revealed the age of the hotel. But the bath is of ample size with all necessary amenities, including a night light, and quite adequate shower pressure. Tips Â· If you have a couple of hours to kill, a trolly/bus stops right in front of the hotel and goes on a loop to Manhattan Beach and a couple of shopping centers. The ride has an excellent recorded narrative describing points of interest along the route. Round trip tickets were just $3/person. Â· If you have more time, you can take the courtesy bus back to the airport and catch a free shuttle to the closest Metro stop. A day pass on Metro is $5, giving you access to all of LA. If you have the time and inclination, the Walt Disney Concert Hall a short walk from a Metro stop, where you may take a free audio tour of the facility. You can visit LA City Hall and enjoy a panoramic view of the city from the top floor, also free, or visit the nicely restored Union Station. The Metro even stops near Hollywood & Vine and other Hollywood locations.

Reviews.Title: “Improved Experience - Great for LA Overnighter (combines two reviews)”
Reviews.Author: mike110742
Reviews.Content: March 2010 Improved Experience, Excellent Choice for LAX Overnighter Because TA will allow only one review per hotel, this is a combo of two visits. Iâ€™ve criticized this hotel in previous review (below), based on an abundance of small, customer-unfriendly irritants and finding a room not ready (once). (See below for an earlier review and a message to third-party guests. Usually, I get rooms in this hotel via Priceline, and although itâ€™s rated as 3.5 star, bidding for a 3-star will often return Crowne Plaza. Bid $50 or less.) Some of the caveats remain, but some things have improved: NOTABLE: (I am now known by name, and am on a list of some kind at the hotel, so this may get me a level of treatment not given to all guests.) Checkin was swift and easy. I was placed on the 15th floor, reserved for CP â€œpriorityâ€� guests, and given a room with a nameplate that identified it as a suite. It was different from other rooms in attractive but cosmetic ways: faux marble entry and bathroom floor; a lovely quiet-flush toilet, an attractive ice bucket and new furniture fixtures, a soft ceiling light next to the bed, and a bottle of water. An airport shuttle runs about every 20 minutes. Nearby competitors (Courtyard, Radisson) offer free wireless, so the $11 charge is an irritant, but the option to buy 2 hours @ $2 works and download speeds are nothing short of remarkable--500 KB/sec, twice what I get at home. Free wireless that doesnâ€™t work, common in hotels, is a big marketing mistake. BE WARNED: The shuttle is not announced inside the hotel lobby--you need to be outside. The stops are brief and you can fail to get a seat the shuttle because it is too crowded. (Itâ€™s run by a vendor, and also stops at Radisson.) Plan this possible delay into your trip. Another guest told me she missed two prior shuttles, and when she asked a bell desk employee, he was dismissive. In her words: Thirty seconds is not enough for me to get my luggage and myself outside. Announcing the shuttleâ€™s arrival INSIDE the lobby is a small step that would help some slower-moving or hard-of-hearing guests a lot. A coupon given at check in for 50% off food and beverage used to help small eaters, but now applies to buffet only. The price of the buffet is high to begin with, so this is a big bonus for big eaters. Room doors still slam--hard. This is addressed by asking guests for quiet on the door tag, which clearly does not work. A fix would probably involve installing hardware closures, a big job. The hotel web site notes free local-area-shopping transportation but an inquiry to the concierge produced a referral to a taxi. The bus transit center is on 96th, a 1/4 mile walk. Know in advance the route youâ€™re looking for, and have exact change for the fare. January 2010 Exceptional Bedding, Many Customer-Unfriendly Irritations [This note to Priceline & other third-party guests precedes all my reviews of hotels I purchased through a 3rd party vendor] 3rd-party customers read reviews and arrive with expectations; high attentiveness to guest needs distinguishes one 2-3-4 star from others. Third-party prices fill rooms, and provide the business with opportunities to sell services and win future customers. My advice: pay attention to reviews, articulate needs clearly (both in advance and on arrival) and speak directly and immediately to management if your expectations are not met. If basic room needs are unmet, ask management for adjustment; if unresponsive, tell the 3rd-party vendor in writing; use snail mail to the companyâ€™s street address and direct to Customer Service VP. Iâ€™ve found them responsive. Talk to management directly and pleasantly: they value meaningful guest feedback and often can use information you provide to correct persistent problems. Whatever rate you paid, be courteous and civil to a fault: it never helps to be confrontational. Commend with care what is commendable.] At almost any time of year, rooms can be had for LAX-friendly overnights at $40-50 on Priceline. If you are bidding on higher-star hotels, you may be rejected under $95. Donâ€™t fail to adjust your bid DOWN if you drop star levels from 4 to 3.5. CP is treated as 3.5, but it can nearly always be had for under $50 on Priceline, and if you are bidding on 3-stars you may get it (3.5) instead, described by Priceline as an â€œupgrade.â€� COMMENDABLE: Guest laundry, regular free airport shuttle, very nice bedding. Expensive but well-operating wireless internet, with 2-hour-at-$1.95, 4-hour at $4.95 (What??) and 24 hours at 10.95. Simple but good curtain closures. Reasonable heat and cool controls.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but not that bad.”
Reviews.Author: travellerdnc0910
Reviews.Content: I was SO worried after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and seeing some traveller photos. But when we got to the room I heaved a sigh of relief. The hotel was certainly old and has renovation plans soon. But I think housekeeping did a decent job of ensuring a good standard of cleanliness in the bathroom and bed, which were the only 2 places that mattered to me. However some comments are definitely true: Service could use a smile - I think most fast food places have friendlier service staff! The carpets made me wish I had slippers to walk around in, and anything else with a fabric surface have probably seen better days. Do not expect HDTV. And the location is not convenient for trying to shop/eat/be a tourist, so if you're trying to get around LA, renting a car would be useful.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if You Can”
Reviews.Author: jmzr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the property as "VIP" Priority Club Reward guest and was promptly assigned the "exclusive" Club Floor. I was thinking this would be great!! Hallways were stinky, carpets stained, and that was just on the way to the room. Upon entering the room, it was like stepping back into the 60's. Carpet had many stains and was well worn. Case goods were all beat up and marked up. TV was like the one I have in the garage at home. Beds were nicely made up with the new Crowne bedding package and were comfortable. And to top it off, the Club Room was closed on Saturday morning for continental breakfast, which is one of the main amenites!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: MissCarmelita
Reviews.Content: We got caught in flight cancellations & were finally shuttled by Amer.Airlines down to this hotel from John Wayne Airport. AA had given us a voucher for a free room after confirming they could host us. Woman at front desk was NOT happy & said they had no rooms. Then she had someone make a call & we got a room. I am not one to normally write reviews; BUT this was over the top for me. Room was the Dirtest room I've ever stayed in!! Carpet FULL of stains; Window COVERED completely in dirt. etc. I could not sleep that night thinking of the 'cuddies' I couldn't see. Then, after we got home, I saw the bill my husband had, AND they CHARGED US for the room!!!! Never Again.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: juillet_25
Reviews.Content: The best point of this hotel was transportation from/to the LAX. the room was big but not clean. The staff was not friendly and kind.

Reviews.Title: “intolerable service”
Reviews.Author: kitwithbell
Reviews.Content: Because departing time was early morning, I had made a reservation at Crowne Plaza Los Angeles-International Airport. After the trip, we arrived at hotel late night. Firstly, I stopped my car in front of hotel and took my luggages from the trunk. My wife checked in and asked if luggage service was available. Because of late night, almost 11 PM, we're answered it was impossible. We found that Luggage carter was also locked. As my 4 year old son had already fallen slept, my wife hasten and get into the room holding the slept son and I had no choice but waiting for her return in front of the hotel. That's because my luggages was there. A vallet parking service man was asking how im going to park my car. I answered that I was thinking to do self parking after my wife return. He strengthen to tell me that I was not able to stop over 20min in front of hotel. My wife had not return even after 20mins. I loaded my luggage into the trunk and parked at parking lot beside hotel. Actually, I was upset to my wife not returning promptly. Finally, I heard what happend from her. She tried to open the door holding my little son and failed it with the key she got. She went down to the counter and said that the key had problem. Receptionist got it, updated, and returned it silently. But the updated key also didn't work. A repair man came trying to open the door but he couldn't do it even with master key. We asked for changing the room and should wait for a long time to get another room. Even the repair man felt sorry however the receptionist didn't try to help anything and treated us very rude. we haven't heard anything to make us feel better, like Hello, Hi, thank you, Sorry etc from the receptionist. Hotel location is next to Airport, not bad. However, it's first time to experience this kind o service. This kind o things, key problem or door locking can be happened. However, the service of the receptionist an not be understandable. I never recommend this hotel due to unkind and rude service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Quality is declining”
Reviews.Author: NHfamilytravels
Reviews.Content: Carpet has stains, bathroom tub did not even drain the water--it was just gross. Beds are comfortable, but the appearance of the room and hotel corridors are terrible. It is convenient to LAX and they have a shuttle, but so don't other hotels. This hotel is in need of updating.

Reviews.Title: “Room and corridor were 1 star quality”
Reviews.Author: JBurton
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, Feb 16, 2010, on the way home from SE Asia. Got this place through Priceline for $42 plus taxes/fees. Stayed in room 411. The corridor and room were about 5 years late in getting refurbished. The wallpaper was peeling, the carpet was badly worn/stained, the bathroom needed a complete rehab, etc. I probably got the proverbial priceline room. Asked the desk clerk if any of the nearly 600 standard rooms had been upgraded lately and she said no, they all looked liked mine. Find that hard to believe. On the positive side, the bed was clean and comfortable, with lots of pillows. The lobby floor was the only area I'd consider 3 stars; the room/corridor was 1 star at best. This dump is in walking distance from LAX and they do have a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Worn down/Ants”
Reviews.Author: hallie4114
Reviews.Content: Got the room off price line for $50, which was a great price until we go there. The rooms were very worn down, and the first room I went into the bathroom was covered in ants. I mean hundreds of them... I went back down stairs and they changed my room to a different floor. We only stayed one night, which I was thankful for. The Crowne Plaza brand needs a serious upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the brand, but the 'Club' lounge was disappointing -- short hours.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelCouple
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for LA International Airport, rooms well sound-proofed for the airport noise. Comfortable, clean, what you'd expect from an Intercontinental Hotels Group up-brand. The 'club level' room was hardly different from their very pleasant regular rooms, and the 'club lounge' had very restricted hours -- perhaps because most guests are enroute to/from LA International Airport and so don't care about a separate semi-private lounge/bar open all day and all evening. That said, however, the club lounge manager went out of his way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible during the short hours his club was open -- excellent service, excellent food from his kitchen staff, generous wine pourings. He made all the difference in our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Watch Your Step Or Urine Trouble”
Reviews.Author: SolarAttic
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 741 at the Crown Plaza LAX on Jan 21-24 2010. All I can say is the bathroom truly took my breath away. Its smelt like a outhouse brought to a slow boil. The carpet was filled with stains, the furniture was functional but seriously water damage the finish is bubbling off or missing. I will say that my bed was refreshed everyday and room was marginally cleaned. I will say if you have allergies to dust I suggest calling housecleaning to wipe down your room before you take possession of it. While I was purchasing bottled water at the snack bar in the lobby I was approached by a homeless man asking for money. The employee was horrified that this took place and apologized giving me a break on the price of my water. The staff was the bright spot of this stay and very friendly when encountered by them. The shuttle service to the airport was very nice . If the Crown Plaza would update the room and clean up the bathroom this would be an awesome place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Surprised... by how bad it was...”
Reviews.Author: tropicalM
Reviews.Content: I thought Crowne Plaza was supposed to be an above-average hotel chain... Maybe it was just this particular location that needed some improvements...? The problems I faced were: -room was very dated - loud air-conditioner -carpet was dirty -STAINS on the white bed cover -bathroom sink didn't drain well -bathroom appeared dirty -thin walls - and unfortunately, the person staying in the next room was coughing the WHOLE NIGHT (well not the hotel's problem) Glad I was only there for one night. Good things about this hotel were the location and its free shuttle service. It should be a 2.5-star hotel with an average nightly rate of $50.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, room issues, but not awfull”
Reviews.Author: Family_Guy
Reviews.Content: OK, on the whole this is an OK hotel, but a few things happend during my stay that bugged me, and if you read my other reviews it is clear that I am NOT someone that complains much. I was happy to get a great rate on Priceline for this hotel, but when I checked in I went up to our room, opened the door and there was a towel on the floor and the TV was on?? I thought I was barging in on someone so I had to yell "hello, hello" but the room was vacant. Looked like the cleaner failed to turn off the TV and left a dirty towel on the floor. Went to the "Dinning Room" for dinner, but the waiter walked us down the dinning room and through a door and sat us in the bar under a TV playing sports with no Explanation?? Other people were seated in there too and they also seem confused. I wanted to treat my wife to a nice dinner but ended up having pizza in the Pub! Yes I know I could of ordered off the main menu but why pay for a fancy meal if you have to eat it under a TV with some game I don't care about. Other than that it was prretty typical. I just get the impression that because most people probably only stay there one night before or after a flight, they don't worry about making you feel too comfortable. If you are booked into this hotel, don't worry, its fine, but I really did not feel it lived up to the Crowne Plaza name.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt have believed it if I hadnt been there”
Reviews.Author: cpallo
Reviews.Content: WOW. I have just returned from a trip and was so blown away by this hotel that I had to take the time to write. It started with a rude front desk staff, who could not accomodate my room requests as they were "overbooked to begin with". I had prepaid the room well in advance, so how is this my issue? Went to the room, was unaware he had put me into a smoking room, until the elevator door opened and I was almost blown over by the stench. Went into the room and almost gagged from the smoke. The plain beige carpets looked almost paisley with the amount of multi colored stains that embossed (meaning that they were not all sunk in, some were "raised" stains - meaning more like gum on carpet). The carpet that comes up on the wall that acts as a baseboard was peeling off in some spots. The chair that is in the room had some grotesque soil marks on them - not sure what went on there. There were marks on the wall that looked like they may give you a disease if you touch them. UGH. As I could barely breathe, I had to complain to the surly front desk clerk, who reminded me that they were sold out. As I couldnt accept this, he was going to have his manager call me back. He then called back himself to let me know that they were having another room cleaned for me on a non-smoking floor. (Strange how that just came up, hmmm?). Moved into that room which was cleaner than the first, yet the carpet still looked soiled beyond belief and marks were on the wall here too. The bed was clean, but it was the kind that is so worn that you fall into the middle and then feel like you are trying to roll uphill to get back to the side. I checked the room to see if the sheets and towels were clean - the sheets were spotless, but one of the hand towels had a chunk of something that I can only hope was chocolate or caramel stick to it. Shocking. Unbelieveable. My friend said it well when he described the room as "something one expects to find at a seedy motel on route 66..." We stayed there due to its proximity to the airport, and this was the only positive thing I can come up with about this place. It was close.

Reviews.Title: “As Advertised”
Reviews.Author: MT5211
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night in December 2009 for an airport layover returning from Asia to New York. The hotel is clean, reasonably modern, comfortable and (via Priceline) affordable. As an airport hotel it very well fits the purpose as a layover spot but being isolated it definately is not recommended for anything other than an airport layover. The hotel shuttle to the airport is good and the hotel is so close you could walk it if you can negotiate the roads and sidewalks in an unfamilier neighborhood. There is no reason to leave the hotel because the neighboorhood contains nothing else but other airport hotels, some office buildings and rental car lots. What little interaction I had with staff was ok but they didn't even offer to have anyone take my bags. They did make the offer to the people in line before me so I must have not been beautiful enough for LA... On site are a pizza shop, restaurant and bar. I grabbed a pizza and coke for my room in the evening and the price was acceptable and the pizza was fresh. They did give me a 50% off coupon for the breakfast buffet and I'm glad they did because full price would have been an outrage. The breakfast buffet was average. For what I wanted the hotel did the job and it was above average.

Reviews.Title: “close to airport for convenience”
Reviews.Author: ford37
Reviews.Content: Used the Hotel as a resting point for an overnight stop over before flying out the next morning. Hotel staff were very friendly, the concierge was extremely helpful. The room was adequate without being outstanding, but the close location to the airport caused problems getting to sleep because of aircraft noise. Airport shuttle service was good, but could be a little drawnout depending on how many Hotels had to be visited for pick ups.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable bed and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: flowers52
Reviews.Content: We bid this hotel on priceline so it was a reasonable price. The bed was very comfortable. The room was clean, free shuttle to and from the airport. The check in staff was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Thorougly average”
Reviews.Author: XCountryFlyer
Reviews.Content: Fortunately, my experience here was completely average compared to other more unfortunate guests. I'd rate the hotel 3 stars. Got the hotel for $39/night before taxes on Priceline. PL rates it 3.5 stars, but it really is a 3 star hotel. The overall amenities on paper may make it 3.5, but the reality isn't quite so good. Check-in service was fine. Got a room on the 10th floor and the room seemed clean enough, but I am not as picky as some. The windows are useless at keeping airplane noise out. Bring earplugs or sleep drugs if you have a hard time falling asleep. But if you're an airplane lover, a view of the runways is great. I didn't call the front desk for services or use the gym. Parking on 98th St. behind the hotel is free, limited to 2 hour stints from 8AM-12AM. They use white chalk on the rear tire when parking enforcement go by... Verdict: Was a thoroughly average hotel. If you're not getting this for cheap, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place. Felt like a king.”
Reviews.Author: pngalim
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay at. Clean rooms excellent services!

Reviews.Title: “Its good for a night!”
Reviews.Author: dominik_r
Reviews.Content: Airport Hotels are mainly boring as they are mostly located in the middle of nowhere next to a highway. So one could judge such a hotel just for efficiency. The Crown Plaza LAX is such an efficient Hotel. Room dÃ©cor is not my cup of tea, but they are fairly large and have everything you might need for your night over. Internet access was fast but they do charge for it. To be fair rates are cheap- 2 hours for 1,95USD. What I really like about American style Hotels are the vending machines on each floor as well as the laundry facilities. If you are traveling a lot with just cabin luggage your will appreciate this. I checked out the pool, but its far to small for some laps and not really nice. I had dinner at the Bar, which was quiet good- nothing special but does the job. There is a Starbucks in the Lobby if you just want grab a coffee in the morning before heading to the airport. The free airport shuttle was efficient. What else should I add? If rates are good I wonâ€™t hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Swan_tim
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times before for business due to clients being based near LAX, and it offers everything I need from a hotel. Free shuttle to and from the airport, clean rooms, restaurant and bar. It is generally offering a great rate too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: FNC058
Reviews.Content: Spent one night due to a layover at LAX and found the hotel to be very beat up and not well maintained at all. The morning bellman was nice though the rest of the staff just seemed to be there and that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in great location but rooms urgently need a refurb”
Reviews.Author: sydneyberlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this airport hotel for one night after arriving from Australia so we could cure our jetlag before hitting the road. Great location right at the airport and the noise was fairly well isolated for this location even though we could hear the roaring engines of planes taking off. Service was alright and the pool little but offering great opening hours and a welcome refreshment from our flight. Only downfall is the quite old-fashioned room with rather ugly 80ies looking bedsheets and the usual run down carpets etc. Room was also extremely dimly lit which we noticed in many hotels in the area- must be a US thing. Either way- the rate was extremely cheap so you can't really complain about the room which needs a bit of an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mikeygwm
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great Beds, Great Value, Great Service,

Reviews.Title: “When they leave ear plugs on your pillow, take the hint!”
Reviews.Author: fanball
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at the hotel to catch an early am flight to save us getting up at 3 am to drive to LAX. Needless to say there was no sleeping, the noise was HORRIBLE. The $175.00 bill even with the week of free parking was not worth it. Neither of us could sleep. Next time we will get up at 3:00 and drive the hour and a half, 4 hours of sleep is better than no hours of sleep. No FREE internet! I will look for another chain hotel that we have used before that has consistent levels of cleanliness and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was wonderful at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ethis2me
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so wonderful at the hotel, the staff was great. It was quiet, fell right asleep when I layed my head on the pillow. Check in and check out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Not reccomended”
Reviews.Author: stevewwww
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza LAX 28/09/09 - 02/10/09 with my wife. This was a stop over on our return from Cuba. Booked the hotel for 4 nights via WOTIF and paid for in advance. I found the hotel run down, the staff incompetent and not friendly. Upon checking out I found out that I had been double billed for the room and my Visa card had been debited to that effect. I pointed this out to the incompetent receptionist who assured me that she had corrected the mistake and credited my account. I returned to Australia to find that I had still been double billed. I had to contact the hotel and request my money be returned. This was a battle in itself. Seven days later most of the money was returned to my account minus $40.00 US. This must have been the fee I was charged for their mistake. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and I would never stay in this one again. Unbelievable?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was amazing shuttle service was out of their control”
Reviews.Author: krasont
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great rooms were cleaned before noon. The only downfall was out of the hotels control. They have a shared shuttle and well seemed like I had to wait over 30 min everytime I took it back from the airport. They are suppose to run every 15 minutes but this did not seem to be the case

Reviews.Title: “Prefer other Lax Airport Hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: Normally we stay at the Sheraton Lax Airport Hotel but this time we decided to try the Crowne Plaza seeing we are Priority Club Members. Thereâ€™s nothing much to say about this hotel than I wished we had stayed at the Sheraton. The hotel room was small, smelly and in need of a total revamp to make it into a reasonable standard. We arrived around 8pm and went looking for something to eat but the Brasserie Restaurant menu seemed limited and extremely ordinary, so we opted to walk across the road to the Sheraton and had a lovely meal in their Grill House Restaurant. The staff were helpful and friendly and we managed to use the shuttle bus in the morning to the airport which was handy. Overall â€“ The hotel served a purpose as an overnight stopover hotel. Its reasonably priced but the rooms all need a major renovation. If on a budget then this hotel is okay however if looking for a little more regarding standards hop on over to the Sheraton Hotel you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “the trick is out”
Reviews.Author: Craxiter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and the previous posting is completely correct, you should ask for a King nonsmoking on an upper floor on the north side. I have had only one stay that was on a lower floor facing south (Century Blvd) and that was the only time I was not very happy. I last stayed 3 nights, then 5 nights shortly after that. The Thursday jazz band was good even though I never thought I liked jazz. There are pricey items on the dinner menu but also fairly reasonable ones. Breakfast is perhaps a bit pricey but the continental buffet is not a bad deal, and the prices of the buffet include coffee. There is now a Subway a couple blocks west on Century Blvd. if you have restaurant sticker shock. I just discovered the steam room which was good.

Reviews.Title: “The trick to getting a nice room......”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of frequent travelers, I needed a room for an early morning flight at LAX. Priceline 48 bucks no problem. Dismayed at some of the current reviews most of which were unfounded. Once I got the room on Priceline, I telephoned the hotel and "requested" a king non-smoking room. I also gave them my Priority Club frequent member number being aware that I was not going to get points. Check-in was a breeze, my room request was honored and I was on the Priority Club floor, which of course guaranteed a nice room; which it was, clean, spacious, and a comfortable bed. Additionally, they gave me 50% off the buffet breakfast as a Priority Club member. (I did not use it) There have been a lot of complaints about no free internet even to print boarding passes Yes, it is true, however, they have a staggered internet rate including two hours for $1.95, which is perfect to check emails and print boarding passes. Also, there is free parking directly behind the hotel on 98th Street. It is two hour parking during the day, but I think it is free overnight. Others have complained about the fact that the shuttle stops at the Radisson on the way to the airport. It does, but the added time was about two minutes. Overall, for a one night stay; a great value (on Priceline) and anyone needing a hotel before a morning flight could do a lot worse than the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Solid place with good value”
Reviews.Author: peakbagger3
Reviews.Content: Solid standard clean convenient business/leisure hotel... Great location and dynamite if, like me, you get a sweet rate off priceline. Not the Ritz but very solid...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Blueonblue21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza near LAX for 11 days in July 2009. Within a few minutes of arriving at LAX, the hotel's shuttle bus was there to pick me up. The driver was helpful, polite, and friendly (don't forget to tip him!). I was standing in the hotel's lobby within minutes. The check in was fast (the clerk was very nice!). I was assigned to a room on floor four. Once there, the lady housekeeper saw that I was having some trouble finding my room. She quickly came to my aid (lovely lady!). The room was large, clean, comfortable, and well-designed (I have pictures. If you'd like to see them, just contact me. I'll E-mail them to you). The hotel was very busy the entire time I was there. Whenever I went down stairs to take a smoke, I'd see airline captains, children, parents, guests arriving 'round the clock. This is very much a family hotel. The concierge was always cheerful. The valets were always there (and busy). The lobby has plenty of brochures about local attractions. Very nice gift shop. The housekeepers were super! All in all, I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The floor and room carpets were nasty!”
Reviews.Author: AL1470
Reviews.Content: The lobby is nice, but the seventh floor carpets were full of trash, and were not vacuumed during my stay. They looked like they had not been vacuumed in months. The carpet in my room had lots of stains. The outside of the room doors were scuffed and in need of paint. The furniture in the room was old and beaten. The beddings are usually very nice. There was a hair on the lamp. The bathroom wallpaper was peeling. The rooms and floors were similar to a US 2-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kiss_traveler
Reviews.Content: The room I had was on par with a Super 8 motel. Wall unit AC that blasted cold air right onto the uncomfortable, wobbly desk-chair, and made a huge amount of noise. Thin towels. Just really low-grade room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place so far”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer099
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. Rooms are extremely dirty-even towels and bed sheets.Carpets are dirty and some of the furniture broken. Staff seemed indifferent to complaints. We left the place!

Reviews.Title: “Is a good one”
Reviews.Author: TOURISTRIP
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay near to the airport i think is a good hotel, the rooms are nice, and also the location. I think the valet parking is a little bit expensive. I really recommended just if you need to stay near to the airport

Reviews.Title: “This place was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby. Good view from the room. Not Too much LAX noise. It was a very good deal on Priceline. This area is convenient to Manhattan Beach, which I like.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Location”
Reviews.Author: sgbslo
Reviews.Content: I got a good park/sleep deal here for the 4th of July weekend. I arrived in the afternoon, parking garage is just across the driveway. Check-in was quick and pleasant. My room was clean and everything was in order. While the decor won't likely be published in Architectural Digest, it was fine. Unless you want to drive the only dining choice is the restaurant in the hotel. I did have dinner there and it was just fair and overpriced which is typical of airport hotel dining rooms. The hotel worked out fine for my needs. The airport shuttle bus runs frequently and it was prompt on my departure and arrival. If the price is right, this is an okay choice.

Reviews.Title: “Most disgusting room ever! The Ron Jeremy Suite!”
Reviews.Author: nit72651
Reviews.Content: Just checked into the Crown Plaza at LAX, and it is the dirtiest, most disgusting room that I have stayed in in years-and I travel a great deal. From the hair on the supposedly clean towels, to the carpet that I will not even put a suitcase on, to the desk chair that I have covered with two towels. The whole place is just awful. Sold out, no other rooms available, and I am here for one night on our way home from Maui. There is no free internet, they charge to print boarding passes and the line to check in is nuts. Best thing that I can say about this dump is that there is an IN-n-OUT Burger within walking distance. Do NOT stay here-go to a homeless shelter-it will be cleaner!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is included - not even printing a boarding pass”
Reviews.Author: HockeyFan6
Reviews.Content: I have in the past ranted about charges for high speed internet at higher priced hotels being ridiculous, but this property added a new level of wringing out the last dollar. This is an airport hotel, and I wished to print my boarding pass. In room internet - $10 or so, so I went to the business center - NOT FREE - they charge for use! So I went to the lobby kiosk for printing boarding passes - this charges both for the time on line and by the page. I had $2 in my pocket, so I figured I might as well do this as it appeared to be the cheapest option, but by the time the boarding pass was ready to print (2 pages, thus $1) I had less than $1 remaining - when I tried to go back to print just the first page, the system would not allow it and simply kept asking for more money until my time ran out. The good news, however, is that when I explained my frustration to the desk staff, she printed my pass immediately (no charge) and offered her apologies. Otherwise, an OK hotel very close to the airport and close enough to car rental return that you can drop your car off the night before and walk back to the hotel. Be aware that the shuttle stops at another hotel on the way to the airport and at all terminals, so it can easily be 15 minutes plus before you get back off. Check-in was slow as well - only 1 clerk working at arrival. Rooms need updating soon. I would likely try something else the next stay at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short airport stay”
Reviews.Author: bonjonsc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel via Priceline to use as a day room of sorts on our way out to Australia, as we didn't want to be in the airport from 3 p.m. until our midnight flight. The room was a bit dated-- especially the bathroom-- but the bed was comfortable enough for a quick nap. The hotel restaurant is a huge rip-off-- we had mediocre food for a very expensive bill and the wait staff were disinterested in clearing away plates and refilling our water glasses. There's only a Subway that's walkable for food from here. The hotel shuttle service was quick and efficient, however, so if you're looking for a quick stay, this place is fine. I wouldn't pay rack rate for it, though.

Reviews.Title: “Very old room, do not stay there”
