I went upstairs, completely distressed, and complained to the front office, who, instead of apologizing for it, blamed Travelers Aid, who had done absolutely nothing wrong. Later, when I checked out, they wouldn't look me in the eye and were quite rude when I tried to get my valuables out of the safe deposit box. They wouldn't help me when I told them I didn't know how to work the funky box and finally, after shoving around, I managed to get it open. Please do not stay at this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Hardly 3*”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't really deserve a 3* rating. Its more a 2.5* rating in my mind. Anyway, its an adequate airport hotel for over night stay but if your a light sleeper i wouldn't recommend it as the rooms arent really soundproof and the aircraft noise is very very loud! I had to move rooms twice as i couldnt sleep and i dont consider myself a light sleeper. Its no wonder they provide earplugs in an amenity bag on your bed.

Reviews.Title: “Ambitious 3 star rating .. adequate airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTripper
Reviews.Content: Overnighted here on transit; the hotel is merely adequate for an overnight stay .. definitely not a 3* other than for the name. * Decent shuttle service in and out of the airport * Cleanish rooms * Below-average beds and paraphenalia

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonReview
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel and was pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and comfortable with luxury duvet, pillows etc. The bathroom was fairly spacious and the room service food was good although on the expensive side. It was also convenient having a free shuttle to and from LAX airport. The only downside is the fact that you do hear the planes nearby but since this is a hotel near the airport this is to be expected and did not affect us sleeping! Overall a very comfortable stay and a definite a place I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a hotel airport”
Reviews.Author: pneyu
Reviews.Content: Pricelined it for $55 for one night, and it was fine. The beds were great, parking wasn't bad, and the airport shuttle was very handy. You definitely need a car if you're going to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but wrong location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Ginnythecat
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza is a lovely hotel - rooms are cleaned everyday with clean sheets and clean towels. We had a coffee perculator, hair dryer, tv, telephone, clock radio, iron and ironing board and ice bucket in the room. There is a free ice vending machine on every floor. There is a laundry room on the 15th floor - 2 washers and 2 dryers (1 dollar to wash which takes 30 minutes and 75 cents to dry). There is a lovely restaurant but if you have children and just want a simple meal this would not be the place. There is a mini mart just around the corner if you want to purchase milk, cereals, biscuits etc. We did and put the milk in the ice bucket and had cereal for breakfast. This hotel is definitely for business travellers only. It is the wrong location for tourists. There is a free shuttle bus to Manhatten Beach but apart from that you will either have to take a 40 minute bus trip to get to e.g. Santa Monica or shell out for taxies everywhere. We took the LA City tour (which the consierge arranges on your behalf) and the Universal Tour. These were great but if we had stayed in a hotel in or very near Hollywood, we would probably have had more fun. On the tour, we only had 20 mins at Hollywood (Walk of Fame and Chinese Theatre). I would have loved to go around the shops and stop for something to eat there. To get there from LAX would be 2 bus trips taking about 2 hours or a taxi trip (a lot of money!) The hotel has a well equipped gym and a pool and spa. Great hotel but not for tourists. Strictly for business travellers only. You will see a lot of air pilots and airline crew!! Important tip: Do not take the bus to downtown LA (number 42, if i remember rightly). It takes you to the wrong part and through the suburbs where you see a lot of poverty. We appeared to be the only tourists on the bus and the driver discreetly told us that we were in a bad area and to get back as quickly as possible. There were no taxies to be found (strange!) and when we finally got back we were very relieved. We had been given some dodgy looks on the bus. Go on the Tour!!! Be safe!

Reviews.Title: “Good registration people”
Reviews.Author: catulla
Reviews.Content: We had an experience like the last reviewer. Our Australian travel agent booked us into the airport Crowne Plaza instead of the Beverly Hills one (after recommending the latter!). However, one of the reception staff was very helpful and managed to transfer us to the correct hotel. Their English was fine. The only problem was that when we asked for a taxi, the concierge got us a car with no meter, which was more expensive than a taxi.

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Los Angeles International Airport Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5985 W. Century Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90045
